commit_message:
Developers guide for functional tests

Adding developers documentation for tacker functional tests.

Closes-Bug: 1516878

Change-Id: Ic31a4152d744f3d9a220538d1d7f3c1b6f6698bb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tacker refs/changes/83/246183/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: =========================================== **Functional testcases for tacker** =========================================== Purpose of functional testcases is to verify various functionality of tacker features. From tacker home directory, testcases are located at tacker/tests/functional. ============================================== **Writing a testcase** ============================================== A testcase is written by declaring a class name derived from class base.BaseTackerTest. BaseTackerTest is class declared in tacker/tests/functional/vnfd/base.py A testcase body typically looks as below, class vnfClassName(base.BaseTackerTest): def test_create_delete(self): //Testcase operations //validations or asserts //cleanup In above example test class 'vnfClassName' is derived from base.BaseTackerTest. Testcases typically has sections to setup, test, validate results and finally cleanup. Input yaml files: These are input files used in testcases for operations like create vnfd or create vnf. The location of files is tacker/tests/etc/samples/ requirements.txt: The file requirements.txt lists all the packages needed for functional test. These packages are installed during devstack installtion. If there are any new packages needed, they need to be listed in this file. Asserting values in testcase: The base class BaseTackerTest inherits base.TestCase which has inbuild assert functions which can be used in testcase. Eg: assertIsNotNone, assertEqual Tacker-client: In base.py we instantiate tackerclient object which has apis to create/delete/list vnfd/vnf once given with necessary parameters. Verify tackerclient/v1_0/client.py for all the tacker related apis supported. Important guidelines to follow: 1. It is important to leave the system in same state after testcase is done as it was before testcase, not leaving any stale data on system, that might affect other testcases. 2.There should not be any dependencies between testcases which assume one testcase should be executed and be passed for second testcase. 3. Testcases in tox environment may be executed parallely. The order in which the testcases are executed may vary between two environments. 4. The code added should meet pep8 standards. This can be verified with tox -e pep8 command and ensuring the code does not return any errors. Execution of testcase: From tacker directory , testcases can be executed using following commands: tox -e functional (to execute all testcases) testr tacker.tests.functional.vnfd.<testcase> ( to execute individual testcase) Commiting testcase and opening a review: Once testcase is added in local setup, commit the testcase and open for review using below guidelines, http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html Sample testcase: https://github.com/openstack/tacker/blob/master/tacker/tests/functional/vnfd/test_vnf.py

commit_message:
Make 'default_password_length' datastore-specific

Make 'default_password_length' per-datastore-property.
Set max length to 24 in Couchbase config.

Change-Id: I391bc68b44028412ed25490264cbb1e396d540d2
Closes-Bug: 1572230
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/trove refs/changes/39/307939/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: password_length = ( password_length or cfg.get_configuration_property('default_password_length') )

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-16 21:07:15.000000000', 'files': ['monasca_api/v2/reference/helpers.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/monasca-api/commit/51f5c4ddf024e64fa0c6576849362a09b00d1eb7', 'message': "Fixed HTTPUnauthorized __init__

After upgrade to falcon==1.0.0 constructor
for HTTPUnauthorized was extended with new
parameter 'challenges'.

If role-based validation fails, challenge is

in monasca-api)

Change-Id: I5494e4310fed13207fa05c911c2c63dfc61cf39a
"}]
commit_message:
Fixed HTTPUnauthorized __init__

After upgrade to falcon==1.0.0 constructor
for HTTPUnauthorized was extended with new
parameter 'challenges'.

If role-based validation fails, challenge is
set to Token (the authentication mechanism used
in monasca-api)

Change-Id: I5494e4310fed13207fa05c911c2c63dfc61cf39a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/monasca-api refs/changes/91/317091/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: If authorization fails, 401 is thrown with appropriate description. Additionally response specifies 'WWW-Authenticate' header with 'Token' value challenging the client to use different token (the one with different set of roles). challenge = 'Token' 'Tenant does not have any roles', challenge) 'access this service', challenge)
deleted_lines: 'Tenant does not have any roles') 'access this service')

subject: Fix the ManagementNetValueSpecs param type
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-22 19:31:03.000000000', 'files': ['network/management.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/1a155adbc46a6041bc0ebd703fe0fefff5131bd0', 'message': "Fix the ManagementNetValueSpecs param type

The ManagementNetValueSpecs param type is currently set to string.
This change sets the param to the correct type of json, allowing the
network value specs to correctly parse.

Example Management Network value spec:

{'provider:physical_network': 'management', 'provider:network_type': 'flat'}

Change-Id: I5b12c7251690368d79a4d00725a9d6e0d5e75af8
Closes-Bug: #1573649
"}]
commit_message:
Fix the ManagementNetValueSpecs param type

The ManagementNetValueSpecs param type is currently set to string.
This change sets the param to the correct type of json, allowing the
network value specs to correctly parse.

Example Management Network value spec:

{'provider:physical_network': 'management', 'provider:network_type': 'flat'}

Change-Id: I5b12c7251690368d79a4d00725a9d6e0d5e75af8
Closes-Bug: #1573649
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/63/309563/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: type: json

Explode log tars so they can be indexed

Our existing tars are not available for logstash to index, so
let's extract the logs out into the workspace log directory.

commit_message:
[I18n] Add Zanata dev team as extra ATC

Zanata dev team has continuously helped I18n team and Infra team
to setup our translation system with open source software Zanata [1].
Also, they collect our requirements for Zanata and enhance Zanata.
Since they are not translator, they do not satisfy our standard
ATC requirements, but I'd like to add them as extra ATC
in honor of their Zanata development.

[1] https://translate.zanata.org/

Change-Id: If261702326fb1c7058056b3883b7416021189771

subject: Limit OSD object name lengths for Jewel + ext4
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-17 09:26:53.000000000', 'files': ['hooks/ceph_hooks.py', 'templates/ceph.conf'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/charm-ceph-osd/commit/53d09832e59b3cb268f7ae2d72335b7780905c7b', 'message': "Limit OSD object name lengths for Jewel + ext4

As of the Ceph Jewel release, certain limitations apply to
OSD object name lengths: specifically if ext4 is in use for
block devices or a directory based OSD is configured, OSD's
must be configured to limit object name length:

  osd max object name len = 256
  osd max object namespace len = 64

This may cause problems storing objects with long names via
the ceph-radosgw charm or for direct users of RADOS.

Also ensure that ceph.conf as a final newline as ceph requires
this.

Change-Id: I26f1d8a6f9560b307929f294d2d637c92986cf41
Closes-Bug: 1580320
Closes-Bug: 1578403
"}]
commit_message:
Limit OSD object name lengths for Jewel + ext4

As of the Ceph Jewel release, certain limitations apply to
OSD object name lengths: specifically if ext4 is in use for
block devices or a directory based OSD is configured, OSD's
must be configured to limit object name length:

  osd max object name len = 256
  osd max object namespace len = 64

This may cause problems storing objects with long names via
the ceph-radosgw charm or for direct users of RADOS.

Also ensure that ceph.conf as a final newline as ceph requires
this.

Change-Id: I26f1d8a6f9560b307929f294d2d637c92986cf41
Closes-Bug: 1580320
Closes-Bug: 1578403

subject: Wrong container name in devstack "All-In-One Single LXC Container" manual.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-17 08:37:43.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/guides/lxc.rst'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/69d3b79e03e0ba4c9679bcb5279b226b9606e1ff', 'message': 'Wrong container name in devstack "All-In-One Single LXC Container" manual.

Wrong container name in devstack "All-In-One Single LXC Container" manual.

Link: http://docs.openstack.org/developer/devstack/guides/lxc.html

After creating "devstack" container with below command
sudo lxc-create -n devstack -t ubuntu -f devstack-lxc.conf -- --packages=bsdmainutils,git

The name should be 'devstack' instead of 'p2' in the below command
ssh ubuntu@$(sudo lxc-info -n p2 | awk '/IP/ { print $2 }')).

Change-Id: I7a84b97b03b2dd4338f1d946b7eafb8ec6e3767d
Closes-bug: #1582248
'}]
commit_message:
Wrong container name in devstack "All-In-One Single LXC Container" manual.

Wrong container name in devstack "All-In-One Single LXC Container" manual.

Link: http://docs.openstack.org/developer/devstack/guides/lxc.html

After creating "devstack" container with below command
sudo lxc-create -n devstack -t ubuntu -f devstack-lxc.conf -- --packages=bsdmainutils,git

The name should be 'devstack' instead of 'p2' in the below command
ssh ubuntu@$(sudo lxc-info -n p2 | awk '/IP/ { print $2 }')).

Change-Id: I7a84b97b03b2dd4338f1d946b7eafb8ec6e3767d
Closes-bug: #1582248
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/17/317317/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ``ssh ubuntu@$(sudo lxc-info -n devstack | awk '/IP/ { print $2 }')``).

commit_message:
Add provider_location to cloned volume

Forced backup was failing when the driver returned a 'provider_location'
for a cloned volume, because the return value for create_cloned_volume()
was ignored in _create_temp_cloned_volume().

Change-Id: I709996316e4c212243629e461d36da4152e995e4
Closes-Bug: 1573126
(cherry picked from commit 616a2bd34dee74931ead0d40596da98191ba6f77)

added_lines: def test_create_temp_cloned_volume(self): with mock.patch.object( self.volume.driver, 'create_cloned_volume') as mock_create_cloned_volume: model_update = {'provider_location': 'dummy'} mock_create_cloned_volume.return_value = model_update vol = tests_utils.create_volume(self.context, status='backing-up') cloned_vol = self.volume.driver._create_temp_cloned_volume( self.context, vol) self.assertEqual('dummy', cloned_vol['provider_location']) self.assertEqual('available', cloned_vol['status']) mock_create_cloned_volume.return_value = None vol = tests_utils.create_volume(self.context, status='backing-up') cloned_vol = self.volume.driver._create_temp_cloned_volume( self.context, vol) self.assertEqual('available', cloned_vol['status'])

commit_message:
Refine the docs about testing with real hardware

We should create a new network to ensure the vlan exists
in the switch for test, default network 'private' will
always cause error.

Closes-Bug: #1582590
Change-Id: Ied438e6c581f2083e7c3eb0369ff3e69af72092c

commit_message:
Document PowerVM driver functions in support matrix doc

Add a copy of Nova's support matrix document within the docs for
nova-powervm. Within each section a powervm option has been added,
denoting whether or not each feature is currently supported.

This includes the base support matrix files as well as the library
and conf changes required to build it in the nova-powervm docs build.

Change-Id: I46511c61ce35164ec89098c6d876edb26ca8d261

subject: Fix calculation of role dependency for environment settings
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-13 13:25:00.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-ui/commit/7043beba665346fe8bdaf9dc29ecb75c387abe2f', 'message': 'Fix calculation of role dependency for environment settings

User should be able to turn off a setting if there are no deployed
or ready for deployment nodes in environment with a role,
which depends on this setting.

commit_message:
Fix calculation of role dependency for environment settings

User should be able to turn off a setting if there are no deployed
or ready for deployment nodes in environment with a role,
which depends on this setting.

Closes-Bug: #1581506

Change-Id: I732c6b64a7cd90b73162789231255c29006bb21f

The overcloud pingtest sometimes starts executing before the mysql

commit_message:
Wait for mysql cluster in HA job

The overcloud pingtest sometimes starts executing before the mysql
cluster is fully up and syncd in the HA job. This can result in various
errors during the pingtest, but typically results in an 500 Internal
Server Error returned since the database is not usable by any services.

See the bug for more details.

Change-Id: Id00ae74da819b76a11b8fdc4dd9ab7456f7eb31b
Partial-Bug: #1563554
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci refs/changes/86/298986/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Wait for clustercheck to return 0 on each controller, indicating that the # mysql cluster is fully up and syncd. # https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1563554 tripleo wait_for -w 180 --delay 1 -- ssh $SSH_OPTIONS heat-admin@$(nova list | grep controller-0 | awk '{print $12}' | cut -d'=' -f2) sudo clustercheck tripleo wait_for -w 180 --delay 1 -- ssh $SSH_OPTIONS heat-admin@$(nova list | grep controller-1 | awk '{print $12}' | cut -d'=' -f2) sudo clustercheck tripleo wait_for -w 180 --delay 1 -- ssh $SSH_OPTIONS heat-admin@$(nova list | grep controller-2 | awk '{print $12}' | cut -d'=' -f2) sudo clustercheck

There was a bug in the logic for Flavors' listing in Launch Instance
that kept it from sorting by RAM (ascending).

You can verify this by going to Launch Instance and seeing that by default
the results are shown with the smallest RAM options first proceeding to
larger options.

Closes-Bug: 1433317

commit_message:
Sort Flavors in Launch Instance by RAM (default)

There was a bug in the logic for Flavors' listing in Launch Instance
that kept it from sorting by RAM (ascending).

You can verify this by going to Launch Instance and seeing that by default
the results are shown with the smallest RAM options first proceeding to
larger options.

Change-Id: I92b69284d50fc0ece7e19e2d75bb12349c66b86f
Closes-Bug: 1433317

commit_message:
Improve unit tests about storlet_handler

* Add some assertions to make sure storlet_handler sends proper head
  requests to storlet objects
* Remove unnecessory function definitions
* Skip unnecessory tests about abstract base class

Change-Id: I7e7675f1f5114feaf1727f74677fc5ab3e237792

commit_message:
Add a cluster_network interface when we use ceph

Because of the consideration of security and performance, ceph community
recommend the use of two separate network public networks and cluster
networks. refer:
http://docs.ceph.com/docs/master/rados/configuration/network-config-ref/

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1582095
Change-Id: I8cb0e14f86c859820fbbb8af8f94ac8155338e13

commit_message:
Update auth_url for ceilometer controller noop

Patch I8de5e42102fed2de6bea7bbdd788e86a88f0354c is updating parameter
names for service_credentials section, hence we need to update library
noop tests as well. Also patch Ib30ab84b569ed26c0b7172365f8be39d9f244d2c
missed this change, hence we need to fix it.

Test will be enabled, when upstream patch will be merged.

Change-Id: I228bfe5c815a3a912ccac00c4db27522dcc5592f
Closes-Bug: #1582186
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/56/317356/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # TODO (degorenko): back this test when I8de5e42102fed2de6bea7bbdd788e86a88f0354c will be merged # it 'should configure auth_url' do # should contain_ceilometer_config('service_credentials/auth_url').with(:value => keystone_auth_uri) #end
deleted_lines: it 'should configure OS ENDPOINT TYPE for ceilometer' do should contain_ceilometer_config('service_credentials/os_endpoint_type').with(:value => 'internalURL') end

commit_message:
Fix MariaDB clusters failing with TypeError

This would apply to any type of cluster that uses the galera strategy
while setting the nics on a create call. When we called cast to set()
the object was a list of lists. The set method can not has a list so
this was causesing a unhashable error.

The change is to make the instance_nics a list of strings (what we
originaly expected) to resolve this issue.

Change-Id: I6b04f8b580720e5791e0977a9347d031cdbf9710
Closes-Bug: #1570602
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/trove refs/changes/38/306638/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: instance_nics = [] for instance in instances: nics = instance.get('nics', None) if nics: instance_nics.append(nics[0].get('net-id')) LOG.debug("what is instance_nics: %s" % instance_nics)
deleted_lines: instance_nics = [instance.get('nics', None) for instance in instances]

commit_message:
Fix calculation of role dependency for environment settings

User should be able to turn off a setting if there are no deployed
or ready for deployment nodes in environment with a role,
which depends on this setting.

Closes-Bug: #1581506

Change-Id: I732c6b64a7cd90b73162789231255c29006bb21f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-ui refs/changes/26/317626/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: var cluster = this.props.cluster; var allocatedRoles = _.uniq(_.flatten(_.union( cluster.get('nodes').pluck('roles'), cluster.get('nodes').pluck('pending_roles') ))); setActiveSettingsGroupName={this.props.setActiveSettingsGroupName} activeSettingsSectionName={this.props.activeSettingsSectionName} if (groupName !== this.props.activeSettingsSectionName) return null; cluster={this.props.cluster}

commit_message:
Refactor condition in "get_veth_pair"

* seems there is no need to have grep output,
  so added "-q"
* to prevent "false positive" "-w" key would
  prevent matching similar namespaces
* grep is a condition, so there is no need
  to do checks around return code
* try to use namespace in test expression

Closes-bug: #1582645

Change-Id: I7f38c2657541666c989f8e39e1c5a0e475d042f2

Texts are fixed in confirmation dialogs
about stopping provisioning or deployment of nodes.

commit_message:
Fix get_release_file retries

Due to fact that mirrors are not always up, there is very rare possibility
 that client will waste time of full bootstrap image building due to 2-3
 second downtime of a mirror. Also, due specific work-flow of fuel mirrors
 that may introduces instability to CI jobs.

Change-Id: Icecc1f4e355713ee95ac5e8d0d13ea326630c056
Closes-bug: #1563366
(cherry picked from commit b905e31ebf6311413069a18d6e8210869408264d)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-agent refs/changes/83/317383/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
New workaround for Murano auth token expiry

Murano client continues to use old auth token after refresh.
New workaround creates a whole new murano client instance with
new token.

Also changed program flow so that further 401 error after token
refresh are surfaced. The fact that 401 errors after token refresh
were suppressed was probably why the bug wasn't caught much earlier.

Change-Id: If628528c246090073fde1390e20a60e262b4ebbf

commit_message:
Generate new wwpns on target host during evacuate

During evacaute of a instance using npiv volume use new wwpns on the
target host to make sure the connection to the disk is lost to the
instance running on source CEC if and when it comes back.

Change-Id: Ia2aaee6290097fe8dc8e18ab306ac57ba4f92f24
Closes-Bug: #1570697

commit_message:
Generate only one pair of wwpns when instance has multiple block devices

During evacuate of instance with multiple block devices the npiv wwpns
method gets called multiple times and ends up generating wwpn pair each
time, but we need only one pair of wwpn for each fabric across all block
devices. The fix checks the fabric state in addition to the task state
to make sure the new wwpn pair is generated only once. Also the fabric
state of migrating should not be set on the instance since we are
regenarating new wwpn pair.

Closes-bug #1575135

Change-Id: I5d3079f8c3d86274028551d94ee59bf6f1617f89
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-powervm refs/changes/06/310206/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

This checks if the instance task state is rebuilding or rebuild_spawning :return: True if the instance state is rebuilding or rebuild_spawning """ return (self.instance.task_state in [task_states.REBUILDING, task_states.REBUILD_SPAWNING]) elif self._is_migration_wwpn(fc_state) and not self._is_rebuild():

commit_message:
Docs: Cross ref local tests on contribution guide

Cross reference the development and testing scripts,
tox builds, etc, in the Contributor Guidelines.

As a new contributor to openstack-ansible I was focused
on the Contributor Guidelines and did not find the list of tox
targets hidden under the "Included Scripts" page.

Change-Id: I3332722a517e498c8a19605df998bb739a86991d

commit_message:
Makes tap device name consistent

Keeping device names used by Kuryr consistent with those used
by Nova makes the users' and operators' experience better. It
also makes debugging easier for those used to names employed by
Nova. This patch set changes the tap device name to use part of
the Neutron port id.

Closes-Bug: #1582348
Change-Id: I502f7bba09044106885de28cef8a432d5b5b1321

subject: Addresses Expect: 100-continue client behavior
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-15 02:53:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/c3ac6d0e350f3ad3e5561c524ba2db4af66d9569', 'message': 'Addresses Expect: 100-continue client behavior

Updates to the object storage object services cases with
Expect: 100-continue.   The current test case sends data
along with the Expect: 100-continue header, which does

commit_message:
Addresses Expect: 100-continue client behavior

Updates to the object storage object services cases with
Expect: 100-continue. The current test case sends data
along with the Expect: 100-continue header, which does
not properly mimic expected behavior. Updated the
method to send no body with the proper content length
along with the Expect header then sending the body once
the 100-continue is received.

Closes-Bug: #1573859
Change-Id: I91b486e067a0acacf7ca121e6d5da006554b5348
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/25/306225/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: send_data = None elif 'Expect' in headers: headers['content-length'] = len(data) send_data = None else: send_data = data str(object_name), send_data, None, headers)

commit_message:
Added task to install apt packages idependent of the cinder-volume backend

Packages needed by cinder-volume, idependent of the backend, were installed
only when using a LVM backend. This change adds a new task and variable for
installing/declaring packages commonly used between different cinder-volume
backends.

Change-Id: Idd7fd6f8be710c106210ec5bdc3ecda1071fc913
Closes-Bug: #1580222
(cherry picked from commit 956683b908fd0210289fb0110e50a3b7c95f3cef)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_cinder refs/changes/35/317535/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: Install apt packages common between different backends apt: pkg: "{{ item }}" state: latest register: install_packages until: install_packages|success retries: 5 delay: 2 with_items: "{{ cinder_volume_apt_packages }}" when: - inventory_hostname in groups['cinder_volume'] - name: Install apt packages for LVM backend

commit_message:
First get to swift may fail

Swift client does not like easy errors.  The first call to swift to get
a container that is not there leads to an odd exception.

This change set will check first if the container exists (the first
time) before calling the exists.  This avoids another odd swift error.

Change-Id: I3eed06ddf1a8e50ddae42356c1b48a5f5df41304
Closes-Bug: #1582721
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-powervm refs/changes/80/317480/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self._container_found = False # If this is the first pass, the container may not exist yet. Check # to make sure it does, otherwise the list of the object names will # fail. if not self._container_found: container_names = self._get_container_names() self._container_found = (container in container_names) # If the container was still not found, then just return an empty # list. There are no objects. if not self._container_found: return []

commit_message:
First get to swift may fail

Swift client does not like easy errors.  The first call to swift to get
a container that is not there leads to an odd exception.

This change set will check first if the container exists (the first
time) before calling the exists.  This avoids another odd swift error.

Change-Id: I3eed06ddf1a8e50ddae42356c1b48a5f5df41304
Closes-Bug: #1582721

commit_message:
Use SSHManager for SSH access to slave nodes

Test cases and helpers now use Environment's
SSHManager instance for slave node SSH access.

Change-Id: I1f3c3842c6c83c39d0e0dc602f8024c23dadd545
Partial-Bug: #1566377

commit_message:
Reuse Cassandra connections

Cache and reuse the connections in the Admin and
Status objects to avoid leaking resources.
Initialize the App and Admin objects themselves lazily
at the first access.

The Connection object has been changed to act as both
an instance object and context manager.

Change-Id: I4263b870a1099d345ab1940c61ccdf4680a706ca
Closes-Bug: 1566946
(cherry picked from commit 728df1640f0db27fc541ad368341c98c1e77ef2c)

commit_message:
Update devstack install guide for stable branch

Existing install guide provides details on liberty
and mitaka is already released now. Instead of changing
liberty to mitaka, guide is updated to be generic enough
to install for the given stable branch.

Change-Id: I74bff43637c0aa3763f703fce070ff76faeffd66
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tacker refs/changes/23/314523/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Install from stable branch ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ 1. Download DevStack stable branch:: $ git clone -b stable/<branch-name> https://git.openstack.org/openstack-dev/devstackHere, branch-name should be one of the supported stable branch name in above github repository enable_plugin tacker https://git.openstack.org/openstack/tacker stable/<branch-name> Here, branch-name should be one of the supported stable branch name in above github repository
deleted_lines: Install from Liberty ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ 1. Download DevStack liberty branch:: $ git clone -b stable/liberty https://git.openstack.org/openstack-dev/devstack enable_plugin tacker https://git.openstack.org/openstack/tacker stable/liberty

commit_message:
Adding documentation to dynamic_creds functions

Adding documontation to the following methods:
_create_network_resources and setup_credentials

Change-Id: Id0f0043007175155c5c4eae3795b9439d980fdeb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/94/311994/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: """ For every element of credentials class member creates tenant and/or user role. For network related tests need to set network resource values to False before calling this function because network resources are created in a later step.
deleted_lines: """Allocate credentials and the client managers from them. A test class that requires network resources must override setup_credentials and defined the required resources before super is invoked.

subject: Add a RequestSpec generation migration script
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-07 14:57:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/49d328404cfa9ca717f94c6edf084b20674ad358', 'message': "Add a RequestSpec generation migration script

In Mitaka, we began to create and persist a RequestSpec object every time
a new instance was requested. Given that instances that were existing before
that commit were not having a related RequestSpec, we needed to check
every time in the conductor methods whether the instance was having this.

Now that we are in Newton, we can provide an online data migration script
that is iterating over all the instances (using a marker), verify if the
RequestSpec object is created, and if not, try to persist into that object
the legacy fields we already know.

The marker is using the instance_mappings table for persisting itself, and
yes this is an hack but that's the only solution we agreed for making sure
we were not looping every time on all the instances (which would be a
performance problem). In case we finished to loop over the instances, we
are deleting that marker so that the next call to that migration script
would again iterate over all the instances (using the limit). Yeah, think
of deployment tools like Puppet that need idempotency.

Change-Id: I61b9b50436d8bdb8ff06259cc2f876502d688b91
Partiall-Implements: blueprint check-destination-on-migrations-newton
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-12 20:40:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/6066f42d317d394bfa20e645bd80f63a57f9949e', 'message': "Add a RequestSpec generation migration script

RequestSpec object is created, and if not, try to persist into that object
the legacy fields we already know.

yes this is an hack but that's the only solution we agreed for making sure
we were not looping every time on all the instances (which would be a
performance problem). In case we finished to loop over the instances, we
are keeping that marker so that the next call to that migration script
would not again iterate over all the instances (using the limit).

commit_message:
Add a RequestSpec generation migration script

In Mitaka, we began to create and persist a RequestSpec object every time
a new instance was requested. Given that instances that were created before
that commit do not have a related RequestSpec, we needed to check
every time in the conductor methods whether the instance had a request spec
associated with it.

Now that we are in Newton, we can provide an online data migration script
that iterates over all the instances (using a marker), verify if the
RequestSpec object is created, and if not, try to persist into that object
the legacy fields we already know.

The marker uses the request_specs table for persisting itself, and
yes this is a hack, but that's the only solution we agreed for making sure
we were not looping every time on all the instances (which would be a
performance problem). When we finish looping over the instances, we
keep that marker so that the next call to that migration script
would not again iterate over all the instances (using the limit).

Change-Id: I61b9b50436d8bdb8ff06259cc2f876502d688b91
Partially-Implements: blueprint check-destination-on-migrations-newton

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-05 18:02:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/030503815019a9bb64178742258e5ac974e8a48b', 'message': "Skip racy BGP tests and remove unnecessary use of LockFixture

conditions that can cause intermittent API test failures:

1. Tests related to floating IP's are subject to race conditions

2. Tests that assert advertisement of tenant subnet prefixes now

   so that they are isolated from tests that might concurrently

commit_message:
Skip racy BGP tests and remove unnecessary use of LockFixture

This patch introduces the following changes to address race
conditions that can cause intermittent API test failures:

1. Tests related to floating IP's are subject to race conditions
   so skip them for now.
2. Tests that assert advertisement of tenant subnet prefixes now
   create BGP speakers with advertise_floating_host_routes=False
   so that they are isolated from tests that might concurrently
   perform CRUD on floating IP's.
3. Remove unnecessary use of LockFixture as it is gratuitous and
   and causes confusion. Use of LockFixture was left over from
   previous iterations of BGP where a BGP speaker and network
   binding was 1-to-1. Now that any number of BGP speakers can be
   bound to a network, use of LockFixture to protect BGP tests
   from each other is no longer necessary. Use of LockFixture was
   only intended to protect BGP tests from each other, not as a
   way to isolate them from all other tests.

Change-Id: Ied08ea24861393f4888389966891d3e7dfb1b3e3
Closes-bug: 1553374

Add FakeBackup class and updata backup unittest in volumeV2

Change-Id: I39762bedaeaaf1894f48912ca1b7d59ab50f9f78
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/59/316359/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class FakeBackup(object): """Fake one or more backup.""" @staticmethod def create_one_backup(attrs=None): """Create a fake backup. :param Dictionary attrs: A dictionary with all attributes :return: A FakeResource object with ........ """ attrs = attrs or {} # Set default attributes. backup_info = { "id": 'backup-id-' + uuid.uuid4().hex, "name": 'backup-name-' + uuid.uuid4().hex, "volume_id": 'volume-id-' + uuid.uuid4().hex, "description": 'description-' + uuid.uuid4().hex, "object_count": None, "container": 'container-' + uuid.uuid4().hex, "size": random.randint(1, 20), "status": "error", "availability_zone": 'zone' + uuid.uuid4().hex, } # Overwrite default attributes. backup_info.update(attrs) backup = fakes.FakeResource( info=copy.deepcopy(backup_info), loaded=True) return backup @staticmethod def create_backups(attrs=None, count=2): """Create multiple fake backups. :param Dictionary attrs: A dictionary with all attributes :param int count: The number of backups to fake :return: A list of FakeResource objects faking the backups """ backups = [] for i in range(0, count): backup = FakeBackup.create_one_backup(attrs) backups.append(backup) return backups

commit_message:
Use keystone auth plugin

keystonemiddleware admin settings are deprecated
so we should stop using them in favor of a keystone
auth plugin. This patch updates the config file
to use keystone API v3 by default.

Change-Id: I9d10ac29ab33cbdd845573106960e5f181afdb69
Closes-Bug: 1579801
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/barbican refs/changes/56/314256/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: auth_uri = http://localhost:5000 auth_plugin = v3passwordauth_url = http://localhost:35357 username = barbican password = orange user_domain_name = Default project_name = service project_domain_name = Default
deleted_lines: identity_uri = http://localhost:35357 admin_tenant_name = service admin_user = barbican admin_password = orange auth_version = v3.0

commit_message:
Fix type error in test for DPDK

The method 'warm_restart_nodes' needs iterable
object to be given as 'devops_nodes' argument.

Change-Id: I7971594bf160e90156f920686f644434e0582ec8
Closes-bug: #1582578

commit_message:
remove instructions for submitting constraint update

When we have the constraint proposal automated, we won't need to have
liaisons submit constraint updates by hand.

Change-Id: Ic7b33a7ad4af3fc4a7a32b9b5b9122c196b699aa
Depends-On: I1d2118dc93ec08bc2cfcd4b9dec0b30705ab5198
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/releases refs/changes/13/314113/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Prepare the release request by submitting a patch to this repository. * Set the first line (summary) of the commit message to the package name and version being requested. * If you are not the release liaison or PTL, have the PTL of the project acknowledge the request with a +1.
deleted_lines: #. Prepare the release request by submitting a patch to this repository. * Set the first line (summary) of the commit message to the package name and version being requested. * If you are not the release liaison or PTL, have the PTL of the project acknowledge the request with a +1. #. Prepare an update to the openstack/requirements repository to change upper-constraints.txt to ensure the new release is tested in the gate. You may also need to update global-requirements.txt in the same patch for a release with new features on which a project depends (bug fix releases do not need the requirements updated). Use a ``Depends-On`` tag in the commit message to tie the patch to the original release request so that the requirements and constraints patch will not merge until the release request merges. #. Leave a comment on the release request linking it to the requirements repository update.

commit_message:
Move parts of undercloud-install to puppet

This moves the ssh configuration and installation of openstack-selinux
package to puppet instead of using bash.

blueprint undercloud-elements

commit_message:
Fix error messages behind the modal backdrop

Make the z-index of the messages higher than modals' z-index. This will make
sure that the messages are displayed on top of modals instead of underneath
them.

Change-Id: I222d13e13c01902f4c9e22a6710954ec7e8ed604
Closes-Bug: #1546146
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/81/317581/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: z-index: $zindex-modal + 1;

subject: Generic details display framework
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-23 16:24:53.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/55b9f833f5bb5faa37ebf1dcc26973ca55df148c', 'message': 'WIP: Generic details display framework

This patch provides the ability for the registered detail views for
any resource type to be generically presented.

This patch does the following:
 * Adds a Generic Detail display for routed pages
 * Adds the concept of a Descriptor which contains a resource type name
   and an identifier.  The identifier can be something as simple as
   a string, but may also be an object (if the resource type needs more
   than one value to look up its data, e.g. Pool Members)
 * Adds the ability for a resource type to have knowledge about how one
   of its items may be loaded, so any detail page can fetch the information
   given a basic descriptor

Change-Id: Ie116b52ba196f9240fdc6bbc4a12d37beb9b9fcf
Partially-Implements: blueprint angularize-images-table

commit_message:
Generic details display framework

This patch provides the ability for the registered detail views for
any resource type to be generically presented.

This patch does the following:
 * Adds a directive that displays a set of views (i.e. details sub-views)
 * Adds a Generic Detail display for routed pages
 * Adds the concept of a Descriptor which contains a resource type name
   and an identifier.  The identifier can be something as simple as
   a string, but may also be an object (if the resource type needs more
   than one value to look up its data, e.g. Pool Members)
 * Adds the ability for a resource type to have knowledge about how one
   of its items may be loaded, so any detail page can fetch the information
   given a basic context
 * Adds a generic Angular page (since they all just route to ng-views).
   We will see this used in subsequent patches as well.
 * Sets up a Django route to a non-navigational panel for the Details

Change-Id: Ie116b52ba196f9240fdc6bbc4a12d37beb9b9fcf
Partially-Implements: blueprint angular-registry
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/90/296590/19 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Mistral Nodes Introspection

Update IntrospectNodes action to use new Mistral workflow,
Update Nodes selectors to use provision_state to determine
deployed nodes, renamed Provisioned Nodes to Deployed, updated
NodesAssignment component to use Modal, Removed Introspected
Nodes tab/table

Change-Id: I5c1d9784459f940b559264310fc877cd92887925
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ui refs/changes/23/314023/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: return nodes.filterNot( node => node.get('provision_state') === 'active' || node.get('maintenance') ); return nodes.filter( node => node.getIn(['properties', 'memory_mb']) && node.getIn('properties', 'cpu_arch') && node.getIn('properties', 'cpus') && node.getIn('properties', 'local_gb') );export const getDeployedNodes = createSelector( nodes, (nodes) => { return nodes.filter( node => node.get('provision_state') === 'active' );
deleted_lines: return nodes.filter( node => node.get('provision_state') === 'available' && !node.get('provision_updated_at') || node.get('provision_state') === 'manageable' ); return nodes.filter( node => node.get('provision_state') === 'available' && !!node.get('provision_updated_at') );export const getProvisionedNodes = createSelector( nodes, (nodes) => { return nodes.filter( node => node.get('instance_uuid') );

subject: Introduce support for oslo.messaging amqp driver configuration

commit_message:
Introduce support for oslo.messaging amqp driver configuration

This commit adds support for the oslo.messaging amqp rpc_backend
which enables the AMQP 1.0 driver. A proposed feature for the
Newton oslo.messaging release is an update to the AMQP 1.0 driver
to support a stateless messaging interconnect for RPC traffic [1].

This patch:
* use oslo::messaging::amqp resource
* add new parameters for the oslo_messaging_amqp driver
* update spec tests for amqp as alternate rpc_backend
* add feature release note

[1] https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo.messaging/+spec/amqp-dispatch-router

Change-Id: I8306c56e86f2f8a8d6da1ecbf5eab674e6b1e8bf
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-trove refs/changes/54/315754/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Remove Container panel and action

According to decisions that Magnum becomes COE Management Service,
Magnum-UI should remove Container panel and actions that is for
Docker Swarm container manipulations.

This patch removes following items.
- Container views (table and detail)
- Container actions (create and delete)
- Create Container action from bay table view and bay detail view

Change-Id: Ia18e9fa57e0460b9b1a8b473a005d31cb4acc5ca
Implements: blueprint remove-container-panel

commit_message:
doc: Fix wrong import statement in usage

We should import cfg from oslo_config, not keystone.

Change-Id: I79e3dc573727400d1f6f6474c221726796a6ece2

deleted_lines: from keystone import config CONF = config.CONF

commit_message:
Switch manila to oslo

The messaging and logging options are configured
using puppet oslo module.

Additional changes:

* add dependencies and version of oslo package in
  metadata.json file
* add a release note for switching manila to use
  puppet oslo module
* update related unit test
* switch messaging parameters to os service default

commit_message:
versionedobjects: add json schema generation

Versioned objects have a well defined schema that is available
as python code. This schema can also be expressed in a python
independent way for example with JSON Schema. Nova uses versioned
object to define its notification interface. For the consumers of
the notifications it would be super awesome to have the schema
defined in a easy to process and python independent way.

Change-Id: I2073de230f1a74b275087fe7b0c2b4f5953c51b3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo-specs refs/changes/94/311194/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. =================================== JSON schema for versioned objects =================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo?searchtext=json-schema-for-versioned-object Versioned object has a well defined schema that is available as python code. This schema can also be expressed in a python independent way for example with JSON schema. Nova uses versioned object to define it's notification interface. For the consumers of the notifications it would be super awesome to have the schema defined in a easy to process and python independent way. Problem description =================== Versioned notifications has a well defined schema implemented with versioned objects. This schema prevents nova from changing the structure of the notification without communicating the change to the notification consumers. This communication is done via the version number embedded into the notification payload. However this communication is limited and does not contain information about what is changed in the schema or what is the the structure of a new notification. Notification consumers can understand the structure of the notification payload based on notification samples or based on the nova object model only. If a notification payload is changed then the object model is updated. However this information is hard to consume from software and the consumer shall not depend on the nova object model directly. Also the consumer does not have an independent and automatic way to ensure that the received notification has the expected structure without trying to consume it. Use Cases --------- I as a notification consumer want to have a way to see the structure of the notification payload without looking into the nova object model or using human intelligence to understand the notification sample, so that I can further automate the consumption of the new or changed notifications. I as a notification consumer want to validate that the received notification has the defined structure automatically so that I can be sure my software can consume the notification properly and detect problems earlier. Proposed change =============== Notification payload is a versioned object and the wire format of it is a json blob generated by the oslo.verisonedobject serialization therefore it is natural to define the structure of this json blob with a json schema [1]. This way there would be a python implementation independent, machine readable description of the versioned objects. Therefore this spec proposes to add json schema generation function to the VersionedObject base class. The implementation would iterate through the items in the `fields` field of the VersionedObject class and would use the field type to collect the schema pieces. So that every FieldType object need to have a new function `get_schema(self)` which returns the schema piece of the field. The Object field type will do a recursion and generate the schema of the referred class. Alternatives ------------ As an alternative it would be possible to externalize the object model used to define the notifications and offer it as a python library to consumers. However this would only help consumer that are capable of import python libraries and it would force the consumers to depend on oslo versioned objects. Impact on Existing APIs ----------------------- * A new class method `obj_schema(cls)` will be added to VersionedObject class that returns a JSON schema of the class. * A new method `get_schema(self)` will be added to the FieldType base class. Every field type shall override it to provide the field specific schema. Security impact --------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ None Configuration Impact -------------------- None Developer Impact ---------------- Nova will use the new class method to generate the schema for validation and documentation generation purposes. Testing Impact -------------- Besides unit testing Nova will add test coverage with real versioned objects. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: balazs-gibizer Milestones ---------- Newton-2 Work Items ---------- * update the FieldType classes to provide the `get_schema()` method * add the new class method to the VersionedObject class Incubation ========== None Adoption -------- None Library ------- None Anticipated API Stabilization ----------------------------- None Documentation Impact ==================== None Dependencies ============ None References ========== * [1] The Nova spec tracking the versioned notification work that will be the user of this new API in oslo https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/versioned-notification-transformation-newton .. note:: This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode

commit_message:
Deduplicate code in Neutron tests

Move rebalance_swift_ring method to common helper.

Closes-Bug: #1571852
Change-Id: Id45217ce9f2f61f184db247bbf98d460144b9821
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-qa refs/changes/57/296457/15 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import time from fuelweb_test.helpers import checkers def rebalance_swift_ring(self, node, nodes_count=5, sleep=600): _ip = TestBasic.fuel_web.get_nailgun_node_by_name(node.name)['ip'] with TestBasic.fuel_web.get_ssh_for_node(node.name) as remote: for _ in range(nodes_count): try: checkers.check_swift_ring(_ip) break except AssertionError: result = remote.execute( "/usr/local/bin/swift-rings-rebalance.sh") logger.debug( "command execution result is {0}".format(result)) if result['exit_code'] == 0: # Wait for replication due to LP1498368/comments/16 time.sleep(sleep) else: checkers.check_swift_ring(_ip)

repos: switch centos mirror to use OpenStack mirror

Switch CentOS mirror to use the OpenStack mirror managed by OpenStack
Infra, so hopefully we'll have less failures.

commit_message:
add a random password to oozie service

This change will correct the oozie configuration to use a random
password instead of the hardcoded one currently in use.

Change-Id: I89b20a2c9db0c945c47660cd2b12e0ecba9c5c24
Closes-Bug: #1541122
(cherry picked from commit dce097dd5b06da7affb96ce970d95e9e6dfa8c16)

commit_message:
Remove 'verbose' option

This option was deprecated in oslo.log on Aug 1, 2015. We (Oslo) would
like to remove it now, which requires no-one reference it. This patch
removes mention of 'verbose' from Glance, except in cache_manage which
seems separate.

Change-Id: I8b9e5d3ce5fb19e77b637766f9280a499538cce3

commit_message:
Add support of alarm actions of notification

The api and client supports
alarm-actions, ok-actions, undetermined-actions.
But current monasca-ui supports only alarm-actions and
the other actions follow alarm-actions.
So this patch enables these actions are set respectively.

Change-Id: I07f187f84a78d7d0732ed64e921f7bd1f0ebb831
Closes-Bug: #1575748

commit_message:
[WIP] Provide means of throttling multiple asynchronous calls

Change-Id: Ideb6856b80f6c71f7631ac41ee0b80c2cdade575
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/41/316141/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: booleanAsPromise: booleanAsPromise, throttleAsyncActions: throttleAsyncActions /** * Initiates an execution of many asynchronous actions (passed as an * array), but limits the number of concurrently processed actions to a * certain limit (to not overload the server). Every action is an * asynchronous call wrapped in an anonymous function, each call should * return a promise. Almost the same array of promises is returned from * this function (leaving aside that these are proxy promises for original * promises). * * @param activeLimit * the maximum number of actions in progress at any given time * @param actions * an array of functions each of them initiates an asynchronous operation * on invocation and returns a promise * @returns Array of {promise} */ function throttleAsyncActions(activeLimit, actions) { var queue = new ThrottledPromisesQueue(activeLimit, actions); return queue.initPromises(); } } function ThrottledPromisesQueue(activeLimit, actions) { this.limit = activeLimit; this._queue = actions.map(function(action) { return { deferred: $q.defer(), action: action }; }); this._active = []; } angular.extend(ThrottledPromisesQueue.prototype, { initPromises: function() { var promises = this._queue.map(function(item) { return item.deferred.promise; }); this._runActions(); return promises; }, _removeFromActive: function(item) { var index = this._active.indexOf(item); this._active.splice(index, 1); }, _runAction: function(item) { if (angular.isUndefined(item)) { return null; } var outer = item.deferred; var self = this; this._active.push(item); return item.action().then( function success() { outer.resolve.apply(null, arguments); }, function error() { outer.reject.apply(null, arguments); }, function notify() { outer.notify.apply(null, arguments); }).then( function updateQueue() { self._removeFromActive(item); self._runActions(); }); }, _runActions: function() { while (this._queue.length && this._active.length < this.limit) { this._runAction(this._queue.pop()); } } });

added_lines: /* * (c) Copyright 2016 Mirantis Inc * * Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); * you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. * You may obtain a copy of the License at * * http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 * * Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software * distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, * WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. * See the License for the specific language governing permissions and * limitations under the License. */ (function () { 'use strict'; angular .module("horizon.framework.widgets.editable") .directive('hzEditable', hzEditable); hzEditable.$inject = ['horizon.framework.widgets.editable.basePath']; /** * @ngdoc directive * @name hzEditable * @description * * @example * */ function hzEditable(basePath) { var directive = { restrict: 'E', scope: { value: '=' }, template: '', link: link }; return directive; function link(scope, element) { var inputElement = angular.element(element.children()[1]); element.addClass('editable'); scope.editing = false; scope.edit = function() { if (!scope.editing) { scope.editing = true; element.addClass('active'); inputElement[0].focus(); } }; inputElement.on('blur', function() { scope.editing = false; element.removeClass('active'); }) } } })();

commit_message:
Type checking in pool manager target sync

When this was originally written, zone.created_at was
a string as a result of some oslo.messaging logic,
at some time this has changed to a proper datetime
object. This handles both situations.

Change-Id: I561a21f5b9ffb22cb7ab84297d1029ea8505cda1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate refs/changes/90/316190/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if isinstance(zone.created_at, datetime): zone_created_at = zone.created_at elif isinstance(zone.created_at, str): zone_created_at = datetime.strptime(zone.created_at, "%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%S.%f") else: raise Exception("zone.created_at is of type %s" % str(type(zone.created_at))) if (zone_created_at <= timestamp_dt): elif (zone_created_at > timestamp_dt):

commit_message:
Remove zone import and export client methods + tests

This patch removes zone_import and zone_export client's methods and
tests as they have been moved to designate-tempest-plugin.

Change-Id: I38258c1bdfd32b7719f25df795acde2af5e66eec

commit_message:
Add zones ownership transfer accept to Designate tempest plugin

This patch adds zone transfer_accepts_client's methods and tests
to Designate tempest plugin.

Change-Id: I04ae928dbfc54dc4db8cfca5c2da62183858231f
Partially-Implements: blueprint designate-tempest-plugin
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate-tempest-plugin refs/changes/79/316579/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2016 NEC Corporation. All rights reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from designate_tempest_plugin.services.dns.v2.json import base class TransferAcceptClient(base.DnsClientV2Base): @base.handle_errors def create_transfer_accept(self, transfer_accept_data, params=None): """Create a zone transfer_accept. :transfer_accept_data: A python dictionary representing data for zone transfer accept :param params: A Python dict that represents the query paramaters to include in the accept URI. :return: Serialized Accepted zone transfer as a dictionary. """ transfer_accept_uri = 'zones/tasks/transfer_accepts' resp, body = self._create_request( transfer_accept_uri, transfer_accept_data, params=params) # Create Transfer accept should Return a HTTP 201 self.expected_success(201, resp.status) return resp, body @base.handle_errors def show_transfer_accept(self, uuid, params=None): """Gets a specific accepted zone transfer.. :param uuid: Unique identifier of the transfer_acceptsed zone in UUID format. :param params: A Python dict that represents the query paramaters to include in the accept URI. :return: Serialized accepted zone transfer as a dictionary. """ return self._show_request( 'zones/tasks/transfer_accepts', uuid, params=params)

commit_message:
Switch to keystoneauth

This patch migrates designateclient to using keystoneauth Session
instead of deprecated keystoneclient's Session and plugins.

Also, this patch removes the old designateclient.auth module as it is
not used anywhere else in the code base and its purpose is overridden by
the fact that keystoneauth acts as an abstraction layer for
authentication (handling requests and reauthentication internally).

Change-Id: Ic3cc0fbb76977a04bab322ebcb1c818e75646772

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat-specs refs/changes/61/298261/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode .. This template should be in ReSTructured text. The filename in the git repository should match the launchpad URL, for example a URL of https://blueprints.launchpad.net/heat/+spec/awesome-thing should be named awesome-thing.rst . Please do not delete any of the sections in this template. If you have nothing to say for a whole section, just write: None For help with syntax, see http://sphinx-doc.org/rest.html To test out your formatting, see http://www.tele3.cz/jbar/rest/rest.html ========================================================= Resource plugin for Networking Service Function Chaining ========================================================= Include the URL of your launchpad blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/heat/+spec/sfc-heat Adds resource plugin for Networking Service Function Chaining. Problem description =================== OpenStack neutron suppports Service Function Chaining (sfc) as a offcial sub-project and more details are available at http://docs.openstack.org/developer/networking-sfc/ . Heat does not provide resource plugins for Networking Service Function Chaining and this blueprint is created to provide required plug-ins. Proposed change =============== Add following resource plugins under resources/openstack/neutron/ * OS::Neutron::PortPair: * name - type: string - required: true - update_allowed: true * description - type: string - required: false - update_allowed: true * ingress - type: string - required: true - constraints: Custom constrain 'neutron.port' * egress - type: string - required: true - constraints: Custom constrain 'neutron.port' * service_function_parameters - type: map - required: false - default: {'correlation': None} * OS::Neutron::PortPairGroup: * name - type: string - required: true - update_allowed: true * description - type: string - required: false - update_allowed: true * port_pairs - type: list - default: [] - required: true - update_allowed: true - constraints: Custom constrain 'neutron.port_pair' * OS::Neutron::PortChain: * name - type: string - required: true - update_allowed: true * description - type: string - required: false - update_allowed: true * port_pair_groups - type: list - default: [] - required: true - constraints: Custom constrain 'neutron.port_pair_group' * flow_classifiers - type: list - default: [] - required: false - update_allowed: true - constraints: Custom constrain 'neutron.flow_classifier' * chain_parameters - type: map - required: false - default: {correlation: mpls} * OS::Neutron::FlowClassifier: * name - type: string - required: true - update_allowed: true * description - type: string - required: false - update_allowed: true * protocol - type: string - required: false - allowed_values: [tcp, udp, icmp, any] * ethertype - type: string - required: false - allowed_values: [IPv4, IPv6] - default : Ipv4 * source_ip_prefix - type: string - required: false - default: [correlation=mpls] - constrains: Custom constrain 'net_cidr' * destination_ip_prefix - type: string - required: false - default: [correlation=mpls] - constrains: Custom constrain 'net_cidr' * source_port_range_min - type: string - required: false - constraints.Range: (1, 65535) * source_port_range_max - type: string - required: false - constraints.Range: (1, 65535) * destination_port_range_min - type: string - required: false - constraints.Range: (1, 65535) * destination_port_range_max - type: string - required: false - constraints.Range: (1, 65535) * logical_source_port - type: string - required: true - constrains: Custom constrain 'neutron.port' * logical_destination_port - type: string - required: false - constrains: Custom constrain 'neutron.port * l7_parameters - type: map - required: false Alternatives ------------ None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Mohankumar (nmohankumar1011@gmail.com) Milestones ---------- Target Milestone for completion: newton-1 Work Items ---------- * Add resource related * Add related tests * Add sample template in heat-templates Dependencies ============ None

commit_message:
Add cleanup operation to maintenance thread

JournalCleanup will delete "COMPLETED" rows where last_retried
is older than "completed_rows_retention" (can be changed in ml2_odl config).

This patch is based on the new maintenance thread infrastructure.

Change-Id: Ifa3bda3fcbff23ed313175582d461f09a3a7971f
Closes-Bug: #1567408
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-odl refs/changes/71/307171/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from networking_odl.journal import cleanup self._start_maintenance_thread() def _start_maintenance_thread(self): # start the maintenance thread and register all the maintenance # operations : # (1) JournalCleanup - Delete completed rows from journal self._maintenance_thread = maintenance.MaintenanceThread(self.journal) self._maintenance_thread.register_operation( cleanup.JournalCleanup().delete_completed_rows) self._maintenance_thread.start()

commit_message:
Add python-designateclient as a mistral required package

Mistral recently landed actions to support designate, and currently
there is no way to blacklist actions you do not require, so we'll
have to install all clients until Mistral gains features to enable
selection of a subset of the built-in actions (this is expected
during newton I believe).

Change-Id: I8dffb0d3a7533675c82da5a2c71ccf354696b350
Closes-Bug: #1582651
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/instack-undercloud refs/changes/98/317398/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Ensure required clients are installed for services mistral requires # otherise registering their actions fails. Note these clients are # installed only where we don't configure the service itself elsewhere # and in due course mistral expects to provide a way to make these # soft-dependencies so all actions/clients aren't mandatory package{'python-designateclient': } Package['python-designateclient'] ~> Exec['mistral-db-populate']

commit_message:
Add test for applying of config for list of nodes

Change-Id: Iefc271503e2d0dd73a1f6ffb1cd802b940a7c139
Closes-Bug: #1561482
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-qa refs/changes/66/316166/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @test(depends_on_groups=['basic_env_for_reconfiguration'], groups=["services_reconfiguration_thread_1", "reconfigure_ml2_vlan_range_for_suite_of_nodes"]) @log_snapshot_after_test def reconfigure_ml2_vlan_range_for_suite_of_nodes(self): """Reconfigure neutron ml2 VLAN range for suite of controller nodes Scenario: 1. Revert snapshot "basic_env_for_reconfiguration" 2. Upload a new openstack configuration for suite of controller nodes 3. Get uptime of process "neutron-server" on each controller 4. Apply a new VLAN range(minimal range) to all controller nodes 5. Wait for configuration applying 6. Check that service "neutron-server" was restarted 7. Verify ml2 plugin settings 8. Create new private network 9. Try to create one more, verify that it is impossible Snapshot: reconfigure_ml2_vlan_range_for_suite_of_nodes """ self.show_step(1, initialize=True) self.env.revert_snapshot("basic_env_for_reconfiguration") cluster_id = self.fuel_web.get_last_created_cluster() controllers = self.fuel_web.get_nailgun_cluster_nodes_by_roles( cluster_id, ['controller']) controller_ids = [int(ctrl['id']) for ctrl in controllers] self.show_step(2) config = utils.get_config_template('neutron') structured_config = get_structured_config_dict(config) # Change it self.fuel_web.client.upload_configuration(config, cluster_id, node_ids=controller_ids) self.show_step(3) service_name = 'neutron-server' uptimes = self.get_service_uptime(controllers, service_name) self.show_step(4) task = self.fuel_web.client.apply_configuration(cluster_id) self.show_step(5) self.fuel_web.assert_task_success(task, timeout=480, interval=5) self.show_step(6) self.check_service_was_restarted(controllers, uptimes, service_name) self.show_step(7) self.check_config_on_remote(controllers, structured_config) self.show_step(8) self.show_step(9) os_conn = os_actions.OpenStackActions( self.fuel_web.get_public_vip(cluster_id)) self.check_ml2_vlan_range(os_conn) snapshotname = "reconfigure_ml2_vlan_range_for_suite_of_nodes" self.env.make_snapshot(snapshotname)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-16 11:42:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/releases/commit/2fb38eed04f858431485207f0b412f791fd5f0ea', 'message': 'Release python-ironic-inspector-client 1.7.0 for Newton

commit_message:
Release python-ironic-inspector-client 1.7.0 for Newton

Note that 1.6.0 was released from stable/mitaka due to requirements,
hence master jumps over a version.

Change-Id: Idf8ac1b136ea5a8a6d8636a9c2ded986e58aa395

commit_message:
ensure all projects syncing global requirements use check-requirements

Add a job to openstack/requirements to run the new validation command
that ensures that all repos listed in projects.txt have the
check-requirements job defined. The job only runs against the master
branch, for now. As we improve the reliability of the coverage we may
want to extend this to other branches in the future.

Change-Id: I4b0e8c1aca5e492d7f1d4a7f5c9f135569a27e1c
Depends-On: I61658a7265a77e72401978dda558f41b28a81d92
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/61/315761/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - gate-requirements-tox-validate-projects - gate-requirements-tox-validate-projects

- as we don't have a database parameters in main class we don't want to pickup values from it inside db class

Adding:
- client class with client package installation
- examples folder with example which works with Mitaka release
- spec for db_sync
- adding nodesets spec for CentOS 7.2
- adding class and spec for creating user and domain for trust setup: http://osdir.com/ml/openstack-dev/2016-02/msg02123.html
- class to configure cert_manager_type properties

Known issues:
- In CentOS/RDP cannot create magnum bay due to the neutron issues: https://bugs.launchpad.net/magnum/+bug/1575524
- Trust domain and trust domain user has to be set to ID, not a names. Bug reported to magnum devs: https://bugs.launchpad.net/puppet-magnum/+bug/1581372

Change-Id: Ib923f79da691b5c71bb1c4efba8935c774598888
'}]
commit_message:
Various fixes

- correcting "host_ip" entry to be "host" entry for magnum.conf
- correcting "userid" to be "rabbit_userid" entry inside magnum.conf
- db sync function
- beaker tests are working on Ubuntu as well
- update metadata.json with new openstacklib version
- as we don't have a database parameters in main class we don't want to pickup values from it inside db class

Adding:
- client class with client package installation
- examples folder with example which works with Mitaka release
- spec for db_sync
- adding nodesets spec for CentOS 7.2
- adding class and spec for creating user and domain for trust setup: http://osdir.com/ml/openstack-dev/2016-02/msg02123.html
- class to configure cert_manager_type properties

Known issues:
- In CentOS/RDP cannot create magnum bay due to the neutron issues: https://bugs.launchpad.net/magnum/+bug/1575524
- Trust domain and trust domain user has to be set to ID, not a names. Bug reported to magnum devs: https://bugs.launchpad.net/puppet-magnum/+bug/1581372

Change-Id: Ib923f79da691b5c71bb1c4efba8935c774598888

commit_message:
Fix bug 1582641

Remove stopping listeners in collector module stop method to avoid closing
already closed processes.

Change-Id: I2b5e4db20ad70b195594c6b2bd6293b791c718c8

commit_message:
Added ability for running tests.

* Configuration file shouldn't exist for running test.
* Class Configuration was refactored. If config file couldn't
  be found, object created with empty data. Exception isn't raised.

Change-Id: I614faa4cf17ae0c717d8ee9cad91ac8024924151
Partial-Bug: #1522353

subject: Allow to be case insensitive in the resource name definition
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-16 12:26:56.000000000', 'files': ['lib/puppet/provider/keystone_service/openstack.rb', 'lib/puppet/provider/keystone_domain/openstack.rb', 'lib/puppet/provider/keystone_user/openstack.rb', 'lib/puppet/provider/keystone_role/openstack.rb'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-keystone/commit/79da1045d5dcd34ca67fd6f3f9351a57c7c53651', 'message': "Allow to be case insensitive in the resource name definition

Keystone role insertion are case sensitive. That means that if we have a
role 'SwiftOperator' in keystone and try to add

keystone_role {'swiftoperator' : }

Keystone would fail with Error: Execution of '/bin/openstack role create
--format shell SwiftOperator' returned 1: Conflict occurred attempting
to store role - Duplicate Entry (HTTP 409)

The idea here is to allow the various keystone resources to be case
insensitive.

Change-Id: I49bc82f5b6a790d08a63807207bb7e2a813d71eb
"}]
commit_message:
Allow to be case insensitive in the resource name definition

Keystone role insertion are case sensitive. That means that if we have a
role 'SwiftOperator' in keystone and try to add

keystone_role {'swiftoperator' : }

Keystone would fail with Error: Execution of '/bin/openstack role create
--format shell SwiftOperator' returned 1: Conflict occurred attempting
to store role - Duplicate Entry (HTTP 409)

The idea here is to allow the various keystone resources to be case
insensitive.

Change-Id: I49bc82f5b6a790d08a63807207bb7e2a813d71eb

commit_message:
Allow insecure SSL communications with RabbitMQ

Add insecure option to [rabbitmq] section of murano.conf

This is a partial fix because it improves Engine <-> RMQ
 communications but the same problem exist on
 Agent <-> RMQ side

 Partial-Bug: #1578421

Change-Id: I55207c3016da12be45918a7dc33795abf69627b4

commit_message:
Add test for etckeeper plugin

1. Revert snapshot with 1 node
2. Download and install fuel-plugin-builder
3. Clone plugin repo
4. Build plugin
5. Install plugin to fuel
6. Create cluster and enable plugin
7. Deploy cluster
8. Check plugin

Change-Id: If03b2e65673dbc473c4afcb39dddaa6832725f46

commit_message:
Added task to install apt packages idependent of the cinder-volume backend

Packages needed by cinder-volume, idependent of the backend, were installed
only when using a LVM backend. This change adds a new task and variable for
installing/declaring packages commonly used between different cinder-volume
backends.

Change-Id: Idd7fd6f8be710c106210ec5bdc3ecda1071fc913
Closes-Bug: #1580222
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_cinder refs/changes/19/316519/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: Install apt packages common between different backends apt: pkg: "{{ item }}" state: latest register: install_packages until: install_packages|success retries: 5 delay: 2 with_items: "{{ cinder_volume_apt_packages }}" when: - inventory_hostname in groups['cinder_volume'] - name: Install apt packages for LVM backend

commit_message:
Set security_groups when create internal ports for nova server

Make sure nova server be created in correct security groups
if user specified subnet and security_groups when create/update
server.

Change-Id: Ic93cad4def90f3da25390d871d6a8c14ffe1c5ae
Closes-Bug: #1571975

commit_message:
Add ensure_absent_val behavior to Nuage neutron plugin type

This change adds ensure_absent_val behavior to Nuage neutron plugin
type. This property ensure absent when the value is either specified
as <SERVICE DEFAULT> or ensure_absent_val.

Added spec tests for ensure_absent_val

Change-Id: Ifb9df534463a820ac5b2c3b965e01bc61833f8de
(cherry picked from commit 1aabf093224c9a2037a65d1c5dace7561ff27d48)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-neutron refs/changes/15/316915/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: newparam(:ensure_absent_val) do desc 'A value that is specified as the value property will behave as if ensure => absent was specified' defaultto('<SERVICE DEFAULT>') end

commit_message:
Modify the control_exchange parameter position

The control_exchange parameter is a common for both backends,
it could be moved out from 'if'.

commit_message:
Introduce support for oslo.messaging amqp driver configuration

This commit adds support for the oslo.messaging amqp rpc_backend which enables
the AMQP 1.0 driver. A proposed feature for the Newton oslo.messaging release is an
update to the AMQP 1.0 driver to support a stateless messaging interconnect for
RPC traffic[1].

This patch:
* use oslo::messaging::amqp resource
* add new parameters for the oslo_messaging_amqp driver
* update spec tests for amqp as alternate rpc_backend
* add feature release note

[1] https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo.messaging/+spec/amqp-dispatch-router

Change-Id: I2095cee083c9ca2390df703ad6e3216e428989f9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-ceilometer refs/changes/88/314688/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Move files from mount points to actual file systems
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-28 09:45:25.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-agent/commit/73a5c2ddc5883e908b1061124c41bce7d0730977', 'message': "Move files from mount points to actual file systems

The thing is that sometimes we have file system images and mount
point hierachies which are not aligned. Let's say, we have root
file system image, while partition scheme says that two file
systems should be created on the node: / and /var. In this case
root image has /var directory with a set of files. Obviously, we
need to move all these files from /var directory on the root
file system to /var file system because /var directory will be
used as mount point.
In order to achieve this we mount all existent file systems into
a flat set of temporary directories. We then try to find
specific paths which correspond to mount points and move all
files from these paths to corresponding file systems.

Co-Authored-By: Alexey Stupnikov <astupnikov@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: I1aa7523055ac4bcf6f8a93e9740ccf652ed35cc1
Closes-Bug: #1537699
