subject: Add exponential back-off RPC client
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-09 22:33:13.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/common/rpc.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/common/test_rpc.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/3ab2ada748a5f66c3f1dd717223a2d180f686c89', 'message': "Add exponential back-off RPC client

This adds an exponential backoff mechanism for timeout values
on any RPC calls in Neutron that don't explicitly request a timeout
value. This will prevent the clients from DDoSing the server by
giving up on requests and retrying them before they are fulfilled.

Each RPC call method in each namespace gets its own timeout value since
some calls are expected to be much more expensive than others and we
don't want to modify the timeouts of cheap calls.

The backoff currently has no reduction mechanism under the assumption
that timeouts not legitimately caused by heavy system load
(i.e. messages completely dropped by AMQP) are rare enough that the
cost of shrinking the timeout back down and potentially causing
another server timeout isn't worth it. The timeout does have a ceiling
of 10 times the configured default timeout value.

Whenever a timeout exception occurs, the client will also sleep for a
random value between 0 and the configured default timeout value to
introduce a splay across all of the agents that may be trying to
communicate with the server.

This patch is intended to be uninvasive for candidacy to be
back-ported. A larger refactor of delivering data to the agents
is being discussed in I3af200ad84483e6e1fe619d516ff20bc87041f7c.

Closes-Bug: #1554332
Change-Id: I923e415c1b8e9a431be89221c78c14f39c42c80f
(cherry picked from commit 3e668b6a3720c1509ffef4ad5b91b4242dfd47b3)
"}]
commit_message:
Add exponential back-off RPC client

This adds an exponential backoff mechanism for timeout values
on any RPC calls in Neutron that don't explicitly request a timeout
value. This will prevent the clients from DDoSing the server by
giving up on requests and retrying them before they are fulfilled.

Each RPC call method in each namespace gets its own timeout value since
some calls are expected to be much more expensive than others and we
don't want to modify the timeouts of cheap calls.

The backoff currently has no reduction mechanism under the assumption
that timeouts not legitimately caused by heavy system load
(i.e. messages completely dropped by AMQP) are rare enough that the
cost of shrinking the timeout back down and potentially causing
another server timeout isn't worth it. The timeout does have a ceiling
of 10 times the configured default timeout value.

Whenever a timeout exception occurs, the client will also sleep for a
random value between 0 and the configured default timeout value to
introduce a splay across all of the agents that may be trying to
communicate with the server.

This patch is intended to be uninvasive for candidacy to be
back-ported. A larger refactor of delivering data to the agents
is being discussed in I3af200ad84483e6e1fe619d516ff20bc87041f7c.

Closes-Bug: #1554332
Change-Id: I923e415c1b8e9a431be89221c78c14f39c42c80f
(cherry picked from commit 3e668b6a3720c1509ffef4ad5b91b4242dfd47b3)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/17/314317/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import testtools @mock.patch.object(rpc, 'BackingOffClient')class TimeoutTestCase(base.DietTestCase): def setUp(self): super(TimeoutTestCase, self).setUp() self.messaging_conf = messaging_conffixture.ConfFixture(CONF) self.messaging_conf.transport_driver = 'fake' self.messaging_conf.response_timeout = 0 self.useFixture(self.messaging_conf) self.addCleanup(rpc.cleanup) rpc.init(CONF) rpc.TRANSPORT = mock.MagicMock() rpc.TRANSPORT._send.side_effect = messaging.MessagingTimeout target = messaging.Target(version='1.0', topic='testing') self.client = rpc.get_client(target) self.call_context = mock.Mock() self.sleep = mock.patch('time.sleep').start() rpc.TRANSPORT.conf.rpc_response_timeout = 10 def test_timeout_unaffected_when_explicitly_set(self): rpc.TRANSPORT.conf.rpc_response_timeout = 5 ctx = self.client.prepare(topic='sandwiches', timeout=77) with testtools.ExpectedException(messaging.MessagingTimeout): ctx.call(self.call_context, 'create_pb_and_j') # ensure that the timeout was not increased and the back-off sleep # wasn't called self.assertEqual( 5, rpc._ContextWrapper._METHOD_TIMEOUTS['create_pb_and_j']) self.assertFalse(self.sleep.called) def test_timeout_store_defaults(self): # any method should default to the configured timeout self.assertEqual(rpc.TRANSPORT.conf.rpc_response_timeout, rpc._ContextWrapper._METHOD_TIMEOUTS['method_1']) self.assertEqual(rpc.TRANSPORT.conf.rpc_response_timeout, rpc._ContextWrapper._METHOD_TIMEOUTS['method_2']) # a change to an existing should not affect new or existing ones rpc._ContextWrapper._METHOD_TIMEOUTS['method_2'] = 7000 self.assertEqual(rpc.TRANSPORT.conf.rpc_response_timeout, rpc._ContextWrapper._METHOD_TIMEOUTS['method_1']) self.assertEqual(rpc.TRANSPORT.conf.rpc_response_timeout, rpc._ContextWrapper._METHOD_TIMEOUTS['method_3']) def test_method_timeout_sleep(self): rpc.TRANSPORT.conf.rpc_response_timeout = 2 for i in range(100): with testtools.ExpectedException(messaging.MessagingTimeout): self.client.call(self.call_context, 'method_1') # sleep value should always be between 0 and configured timeout self.assertGreaterEqual(self.sleep.call_args_list[0][0][0], 0) self.assertLessEqual(self.sleep.call_args_list[0][0][0], 2) self.sleep.reset_mock() def test_method_timeout_increases_on_timeout_exception(self): rpc._ContextWrapper._METHOD_TIMEOUTS['method_1'] = 1 for i in range(5): with testtools.ExpectedException(messaging.MessagingTimeout): self.client.call(self.call_context, 'method_1') # we only care to check the timeouts sent to the transport timeouts = [call[1]['timeout'] for call in rpc.TRANSPORT._send.call_args_list] self.assertEqual([1, 2, 4, 8, 16], timeouts) def test_method_timeout_10x_config_ceiling(self): rpc.TRANSPORT.conf.rpc_response_timeout = 10 # 5 doublings should max out at the 10xdefault ceiling for i in range(5): with testtools.ExpectedException(messaging.MessagingTimeout): self.client.call(self.call_context, 'method_1') self.assertEqual(10 * rpc.TRANSPORT.conf.rpc_response_timeout, rpc._ContextWrapper._METHOD_TIMEOUTS['method_1']) with testtools.ExpectedException(messaging.MessagingTimeout): self.client.call(self.call_context, 'method_1') self.assertEqual(10 * rpc.TRANSPORT.conf.rpc_response_timeout, rpc._ContextWrapper._METHOD_TIMEOUTS['method_1']) def test_timeout_unchanged_on_other_exception(self): rpc._ContextWrapper._METHOD_TIMEOUTS['method_1'] = 1 rpc.TRANSPORT._send.side_effect = ValueError with testtools.ExpectedException(ValueError): self.client.call(self.call_context, 'method_1') rpc.TRANSPORT._send.side_effect = messaging.MessagingTimeout with testtools.ExpectedException(messaging.MessagingTimeout): self.client.call(self.call_context, 'method_1') timeouts = [call[1]['timeout'] for call in rpc.TRANSPORT._send.call_args_list] self.assertEqual([1, 1], timeouts) def test_timeouts_for_methods_tracked_independently(self): rpc._ContextWrapper._METHOD_TIMEOUTS['method_1'] = 1 rpc._ContextWrapper._METHOD_TIMEOUTS['method_2'] = 1 for method in ('method_1', 'method_1', 'method_2', 'method_1', 'method_2'): with testtools.ExpectedException(messaging.MessagingTimeout): self.client.call(self.call_context, method) timeouts = [call[1]['timeout'] for call in rpc.TRANSPORT._send.call_args_list] self.assertEqual([1, 2, 1, 4, 2], timeouts) def test_timeouts_for_namespaces_tracked_independently(self): rpc._ContextWrapper._METHOD_TIMEOUTS['ns1.method'] = 1 rpc._ContextWrapper._METHOD_TIMEOUTS['ns2.method'] = 1 for ns in ('ns1', 'ns2'): self.client.target.namespace = ns for i in range(4): with testtools.ExpectedException(messaging.MessagingTimeout): self.client.call(self.call_context, 'method') timeouts = [call[1]['timeout'] for call in rpc.TRANSPORT._send.call_args_list] self.assertEqual([1, 2, 4, 8, 1, 2, 4, 8], timeouts) def test_method_timeout_increases_with_prepare(self): rpc._ContextWrapper._METHOD_TIMEOUTS['method_1'] = 1 ctx = self.client.prepare(version='1.4') with testtools.ExpectedException(messaging.MessagingTimeout): ctx.call(self.call_context, 'method_1') with testtools.ExpectedException(messaging.MessagingTimeout): ctx.call(self.call_context, 'method_1') # we only care to check the timeouts sent to the transport timeouts = [call[1]['timeout'] for call in rpc.TRANSPORT._send.call_args_list] self.assertEqual([1, 2], timeouts)

commit_message:
Move logic of floating-ip creation out of transaction

The section of codes are not necessary in the db transaction.
The port and subnet are guaranteed in neutron db operation,
so the check of port and subnet are redundant.

Add a simple check on IPv6 floating IP.

Change-Id: I9d798ff706a32b84a086a4cb560d50f48353bb65
Partial-Bug: #1578472

deleted_lines: floatingip_port = self._get_floatingip_port( context, floatingip_dict['id']) if not floatingip_port: raise n_exc.DeviceNotFoundError( device_name=floatingip_dict['id']) subnet_id = floatingip_port['fixed_ips'][0]['subnet_id'] floatingip_subnet = self._get_floatingip_subnet( context, subnet_id) if floatingip_subnet is None: raise n_exc.SubnetNotFound(subnet_id=subnet_id)

commit_message:
Accept "ip netns list" changed output format

Now ip-netns also displays namespace ids,
here are outputs:
root@14.04:~# ip netns list | tail -1
vrouter
root@16.04:~# ip netns list | tail -1
haproxy (id: 0)

Closes-bug: #1580963

Change-Id: I2966a19ef078f256464a93be549215648b036828

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-14 01:50:16.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/be219812e789ad6e90282559ef7faf8403c3ba55', 'message': 'LM: Warn message when instance not found while force-complete

The instance might be migrated to another host while we get
force-complete call on the source nova compute node. Warn it instead
of print out exception trace.

Closed-bug: #1556717
Change-Id: Id1b5077c84449468810c4998666ce2647d5f2814
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-14 08:49:55.000000000', 'files': ['nova/compute/manager.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/7a36967c04c1ba1872b5bbbefe0bb31dd9f81e75', 'message': 'LM: Keep silence when InstanceNotFound in force_complete and abort

Add exception.InstanceNotFound in @messaging.expected_exceptions for
live_migration_force_complete and live_migration_abort since instance might
be migrated to another host while we get called on the source nova compute
node and this should not be treated as error.

Closed-bug: #1556717
Change-Id: Id1b5077c84449468810c4998666ce2647d5f2814
'}]
commit_message:
LM: Keep silence when InstanceNotFound in force_complete and abort

Add exception.InstanceNotFound in @messaging.expected_exceptions for
live_migration_force_complete and live_migration_abort since instance might
be migrated to another host while we get called on the source nova compute
node and this should not be treated as error.

Closed-bug: #1556717
Change-Id: Id1b5077c84449468810c4998666ce2647d5f2814
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/85/292185/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: try: self.driver.live_migration_force_complete(instance) except exception.InstanceNotFound: # NOTE(eliqiao): We can safely ignore this exception since the # instnace might be migrated to another host LOG.warning(_LW("The instance %(instance_uuid)s has been migrated" "to another host."), {'instance_uuid': instance.uuid})

commit_message:
Configure Glance SSL verification settings (VMware backend)

Fetch CA certificate bundle and pass it into puppet-glance module
(glance::backend::vsphere class).

Default behaviour of class is to turn off verification (we pass `undef'
value to ::glance::backend::vsphere class), if `vcenter_ca_file' is
provided certificate is verified.

Support of CA certificate setting was introduced in change request
of puppet-glance module Icef5c35ad1128df465da548dd880a0dfeeadb5e1

CA bundle file gets uploaded to `/etc/glance/'.

Provide noop test case.

Closes-bug: #1559067
Change-Id: Id0976706221dbac60c424ba9eb865d84411fc6d0
(cherry picked from commit ac2801b8ba9a73542e14003ed6069e2bb0d1683f)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/86/316886/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: $glance_vcenter_ca_file = $glance_hash['vc_ca_file'] if ! empty($glance_vcenter_ca_file['content']) { $vcenter_ca_filename = $glance_vcenter_ca_file['name'] $vcenter_ca_filepath = "/etc/glance/${glance_vcenter_ca_filename}" file { $vcenter_ca_filepath: ensure => file, content => $glance_vcenter_ca_file['content'], mode => '0644', owner => 'root', group => 'root', } Class['::glance::backend::vsphere']->File[$vcenter_ca_filepath] } else { $vcenter_ca_filepath = undef } vcenter_ca_file => $vcenter_ca_filepath,

Check existing IP before arping

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/56/316656/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: IP=$(echo $IP_BRD | awk '{ print $1; exit }' | grep -o -E '(.*)/' | cut -d "/" -f1) if [ -z $IP ] && [ "$af" == "inet" ]; then
deleted_lines: if [[ "$af" == "inet" ]]; then IP=$(echo $IP_BRD | awk '{ print $1; exit }' | grep -o -E '(.*)/' | cut -d "/" -f1)

commit_message:
Fix invalid uuid warnings in server-group unit tests

Currently, testcases of server-group api emit FutureWarnings
from oslo.versionedobjects about invalid uuids as documented here[1].

This commit changes these tests to use valid uuids so
that when they are run these warnings are no longer emitted.

Fake constants are defined for project_id and user_id as they
are used without '-' at keystone side.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.versionedobjects/api/fields.html#oslo_versionedobjects.fields.UUIDField

Partial-Bug: #1557378

commit_message:
Add nova compatible console logging

This adds nova compatible console logging spec to the list of approved
and not-implemented. It is based on ironic-console-server.

Change-Id: I40e4f71fd3a7f641b47ca86780f463421696ef33
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-specs refs/changes/54/306754/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode =============================== Nova-compatible Console Logging =============================== [RFE] Get console log https://bugs.launchpad.net/ironic/+bug/1526368 This implements console drivers using "ironic-console-server" which provides nova-compatible console logging capability. Problem description =================== Currently Ironic doesn't have console logging capability. Console-log is very useful to investigate the cause of problem on OS booting. Proposed change =============== We will add a command ``ironic-console-server`` and use it for console logging and remote console connection. ``ironic-conductor`` runs it when the node was deployed or turned on, and kills it when the node will be released or turned off. It runs a command specified in the command line option (-c), and saves the output into a log file. To use it, we will add new console drivers like ``ipmitool.IPMIIcsConsole`` It has methods for console logging. (``ironic.drivers.base.ConsoleInterface`` needs to add the methods) And we need to apply them to pre-exist node drivers. Then, ``ironic-conductor`` needs additional REST APIs and RPC APIs to get/clean the content of a log file. In addition, ``ironic-console-server`` has remote console capability. ``nova-compatible-serial-console.rst`` contains the spec. There is a proof-of-concept implementation. See the patch sets in the list at "Work Items" for details. Alternatives ------------ chenglch has a spec for console logging. It doesn't have remote console capability. See below for details: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/164586/ Dao Cong Tien (tiendc) has an idea at the RFE above. It uses ``tee`` program for console logging. https://review.openstack.org/#/c/296869/ Data model impact ----------------- None State Machine Impact -------------------- None REST API impact --------------- 2 REST APIs will be added. * ``GET /v1/nodes/<UUID>/states/console_log`` - gets the content of a console log for a node <UUID>. The response body contains a JSON object like below:: { "context_type": "text/plain", "content", "Initializing cgroup subsys cpuset\nInitializing ..." } * ``DELETE /v1/nodes/<UUID>/states/console_log`` - clears the content of a console log for a node <UUID>. The response has no body. See https://review.openstack.org/#/c/301718/ for details. Client (CLI) impact ------------------- ironicclient.v1.node.NodeManager will be added 2 methods to get/clear the content of a console log for a node. To use them, ironic command will be added 2 sub-commands below: * ironic node-get-console-log <node_ident> * ironic node-clear-console-log <node_ident> See https://review.openstack.org/#/c/301728/ and https://review.openstack.org/#/c/301729/ for details. RPC API impact -------------- 2 methods will be added below: * get_console_log(self, context, node_id, topic=None): Gets the content of a console log of a node. * clear_console_log(self, context, node_id, topic=None): Clears the content of a console log of a node. See https://review.openstack.org/#/c/301717/ for details. Driver API impact ----------------- ironic.drivers.base.ConsoleInterface will be added 4 methods below: * start_console_log(self, task) Starts console logging of a node. * stop_console_log(self, task) Stops console logging of a node. * get_console_log(self, task) Gets the content of a console log of a node. * clear_console_log(self, task) Clears the content of a console log of a node. They will be non-abstract methods (just 'pass'), so pre-exist methods doesn't need to implement them. See https://review.openstack.org/#/c/301713/ for details. Nova driver impact ------------------ get_console_output() will be implemented in ironic driver of Nova. It returns a string, as same as nova.virt.libvirt.driver.LibvirtDriver.get_console_output(). No other impact for nova, and horizon can use it. Security impact --------------- Log files for nodes are on ironic-conductor nodes. It is plain texts. Other end user impact --------------------- None Scalability impact ------------------ None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- To use the new serial console, set ``ironic-console-server`` as a value of ``terminal`` parameter like below: ``terminal`` = ironic-console-server The variable is originally for full path of the binary. So, you can specify ironic-console-server like below: ``terminal`` = /usr/bin/ironic-console-server Also, log files will be in ``terminal_log_dir`` directory and ``tempdir`` will be used when ``terminal_log_dir`` isn't specified. Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Akira Yoshiyama <akirayoshiyama@gmail.com> Work Items ---------- We have to implement unit tests for current patch sets for PoC. For Ironic: * WIP: driver base: add methods for ConsoleInterface https://review.openstack.org/#/c/301713/ * WIP: add ironic-console-server https://review.openstack.org/#/c/302291/ * WIP: console utils: add methods for ironic console server https://review.openstack.org/#/c/301714/ * WIP: IPMItool: add IPMIIcsConsole class https://review.openstack.org/#/c/301715/ * WIP: conductor manager: apply console-log related methods https://review.openstack.org/#/c/301717/ * WIP: REST API: add an API controller for console log https://review.openstack.org/#/c/301718/ For python-ironicclient: * WIP: node: adds console-log related methods https://review.openstack.org/#/c/301728/ * WIP: node shell: add 2 sub-commands for console log https://review.openstack.org/#/c/301729/ For Nova: * WIP: ironic: add console-log capability https://review.openstack.org/#/c/302084/ Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Unit Testing will be added. Upgrades and Backwards Compatibility ==================================== None Documentation Impact ==================== Add configuration description to the install guide. References ========== None

commit_message:
config options: move image_file_url download options

In August 2013 the blueprint "image-multiple-location" got merged
with commit 6f9ed56. This commit introduced another way of
downloading images from glance, despite the normal way via HTTP.
This feature introduced new config options which dynamically generate
new "nova.conf" groups and therefore got never listed in the sample
"nova.conf" file nor in the configuration reference manual.

This change moves these options to "nova/conf/". A follow up change
will deprecate those options as we believe that this feature is never
used in any production environment.

bp centralize-config-options-newton

Change-Id: I140ce486d70e59eaca127d4bc8274c205a2355ee

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-13 15:04:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/bbddc5c4ded7a42c39889a447210a3ba18e20cc5', 'message': "skip lock_unlock_server test for cells

The cells architecture of doing db replay makes this call
fundamentally racey for cells. The contract is that if you request an
action on a server and it is locked, you get a 409 at the API, and are

commit_message:
skip lock_unlock_server test for cells

The cells architecture of doing db replay makes this call
fundamentally racey for cells. The contract is that if you request an
action on a server and it is locked, you get a 409 at the API, and are
done. If you get a 2xx, the resource is not locked, and life is good.

Except in cells, the API db will be updated, and the API will return
all is well. Except the db replay hasn't happened for the cell, so the
additional check in the nova compute for locked blows up.

The fix probably involves the nova-compute check doing a timed retry
under cells because of replication lags.

Conflicts:
        devstack/tempest-dsvm-cells-rc

NOTE(mriedem): The conflict is due to an additional test being
skipped in liberty that wasn't skipped in mitaka.

Change-Id: Ic18407b8372c286d8e258860f3e2bf76eceef2aa
Related-Bug: #1466696
(cherry picked from commit 02de17c72ac0f0824df2b3d460739a58cb6b5285)

commit_message:
Fix yaql conditions for case with empty vips hash

Plugins are able to override VIPs. So the situation when VIPs hash
is empty is quite possible and is used by some of existing plugins.
This patch makes yaql conditions properly handle such situations.

Change-Id: I426e8d8999d51468c9a85ed139ab10ab4397353c
Closes-bug: #1582151
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/14/316714/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add nova compatible serial console

This adds nova compatible serial console spec to the list of approved
and not-implemented. It is based on ironic-console-server.

Change-Id: I60135beceb0a6f75d5660c0475a3336e75087ea3
Depends-On: I40e4f71fd3a7f641b47ca86780f463421696ef33
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-specs refs/changes/55/306755/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ============================== Nova-compatible Serial Console ============================== FYI: [RFE] Nova serial console support for Ironic https://bugs.launchpad.net/ironic/+bug/1553083 This implements console drivers using "ironic-console-server" which provides nova-compatible serial console capability. Problem description =================== Currently there is shellinaboxd-based web console drivers, stand-alone web console and not compatible with nova-serialproxy. Proposed change =============== We will add a command ``ironic-console-server`` and use it for console logging and remote console connection. ``ironic-conductor`` runs it when the node was deployed or turned on, and kills it when the node will be released or turned off. It runs a command specified in the command line option (-c), and saves the output into a log file. To use it, we will add new console drivers like ``ipmitool.IPMIIcsConsole`` It has methods for remote console. And we need to apply them to pre-exist node drivers. There is a proof-of-concept implementation. See the patch sets in the list at "Work Items" for details. Alternatives ------------ Dao Cong Tien (tiendc) has an idea at the RFE above. It looks mostly the same as this spec, but it has another approach for handling ``*ShellinaboxConsole``. See below: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/296869/ Also, Zhenguo Niu (niu-zglinux) has another spec. The basic idea is "nova (and horizon) should have a capability to use current shellinabox-based ironic console drivers". Nova is required to modify its REST API and handle new console type 'shellinabox'. Horizon looks required to handle the new console type. https://review.openstack.org/#/c/300582/ Data model impact ----------------- None State Machine Impact -------------------- None REST API impact --------------- The response body of "GET /v1/nodes/<UUID>/states/console" contains a JSON object like below:: { "console_enabled": true, "console_info": { "url": <url>, "type": <type> } } Using shellinaboxd, <url> is like "http://<host>:<port>" and <type> is "shellinabox". For the new serial console, <type> will be "ics" and <url> like "tcp://<host>:<port>". No change required for the request. Client (CLI) impact ------------------- None RPC API impact -------------- None Driver API impact ----------------- None Nova driver impact ------------------ get_serial_console() will be implemented in ironic driver of Nova. It returns a dictionary, as same as nova.virt.libvirt.driver.LibvirtDriver.get_serial_console(). No other impact for nova, and nova-serialproxy works well with the new one. Security impact --------------- The connection between nova-serialproxy and ironic-console-server is TCP based, like KVM. Other end user impact --------------------- None Scalability impact ------------------ None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- To use the new serial console, set ``ironic-console-server`` as a value of ``terminal`` parameter like below: * ``terminal`` = ironic-console-server The variable is originally for full path of the binary. So, you can specify ironic-console-server like below: * ``terminal`` = /usr/bin/ironic-console-server Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Akira Yoshiyama <akirayoshiyama@gmail.com> Work Items ---------- We have to implement unit tests for current patch sets for PoC. For Ironic: * WIP: driver base: add methods for ConsoleInterface https://review.openstack.org/#/c/301713/ * WIP: add ironic-console-server https://review.openstack.org/#/c/302291/ * WIP: console utils: add methods for ironic console server https://review.openstack.org/#/c/301714/ * WIP: IPMItool: add IPMIIcsConsole class https://review.openstack.org/#/c/301715/ For Nova: * WIP: ironic: Add serial console capability https://review.openstack.org/#/c/302085/ Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Unit Testing will be added. Upgrades and Backwards Compatibility ==================================== None Documentation Impact ==================== Add configuration description to the install guide. References ========== None

commit_message:
Support Ironic console logging capability

This commit adds ironic-console-logging.rst. It contains a spec,
how to support Ironic console logging capability.

Change-Id: I2d419b20caaed7288fbc4278660ca4f18cc20e06
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/93/312993/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ================================= Support Console Logging of Ironic ================================= [RFE] Get console log https://bugs.launchpad.net/ironic/+bug/1526368 It implements console logging capability to Ironic. This spec is for using it from Nova. Problem description =================== Currently, Ironic doesn't have console logging capability. Console logs are very useful to investigate the cause of problem on OS booting. Proposed change =============== Ironic will be implemented REST APIs to get/clean the content of a log file. Then, ironic driver of Nova will be implemented get_console_output() to get it. Nova doesn't have a REST API to clean it, so no method will be implement for cleaning log of Ironic. There is a proof-of-concept implementation. See the patch sets in the list at "Work Items" for details. Alternatives ------------ chenglch has a spec for console logging. It doesn't have serial console capability. See `Add console log support`_ for details: Dao Cong Tien (tiendc) has an idea at the RFE above. It uses ``tee`` program for console logging. See `Nova serial console support`_ for details. Data model impact ----------------- None State Machine Impact -------------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Client (CLI) impact ------------------- None RPC API impact -------------- None Driver API impact ----------------- None Nova driver impact ------------------ get_console_output() will be implemented in ironic driver of Nova. It returns a string, as same as nova.virt.libvirt.driver.LibvirtDriver.get_console_output(). No other impact for nova, and horizon can use it. Security impact --------------- Ironic will return the content of a console log file via its REST API. To secure it, we should use HTTPS. Other end user impact --------------------- None Scalability impact ------------------ None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Akira Yoshiyama <akirayoshiyama@gmail.com> Work Items ---------- We have to implement unit tests for current patch sets for PoC. For Ironic: * `WIP: driver base: add methods for ConsoleInterface`_ * `WIP: add ironic-console-server`_ * `WIP: console utils: add methods for ironic console server`_ * `WIP: IPMItool: add IPMIIcsConsole class`_ * `WIP: conductor manager: apply console-log related methods`_ * `WIP: REST API: add an API controller for console log`_ For python-ironicclient: * `WIP: node: adds console-log related methods`_ * `WIP: node shell: add 2 sub-commands for console log`_ For Nova: * `WIP: ironic: add console-log capability`_ Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Unit Testing will be added. Upgrades and Backwards Compatibility ==================================== None Documentation Impact ==================== None References ========== .. _`WIP: driver base: add methods for ConsoleInterface`: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/301713/ .. _`WIP: add ironic-console-server`: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/302291/ .. _`WIP: console utils: add methods for ironic console server`: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/301714/ .. _`WIP: IPMItool: add IPMIIcsConsole class`: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/301715/ .. _`WIP: conductor manager: apply console-log related methods`: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/301717/ .. _`WIP: REST API: add an API controller for console log`: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/301718/ .. _`WIP: node: adds console-log related methods`: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/301728/ .. _`WIP: node shell: add 2 sub-commands for console log`: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/301729/ .. _`WIP: ironic: add console-log capability`: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/302084/ .. _`Add console log support`: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/164586/ .. _`Nova serial console support`: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/296869/

commit_message:
Improve mock detector performance

Currently Mock Detector runs before and after each
test case. This patch makes it run only before and after
each test class.
While slightly reducing the reporting granularity
this significantly improves its performance and helps
with py34 gate timeouts.

Set the default recursion depth back to '2'
(was reduced in '314577' to workaraund gate timeouts).

Change-Id: I89a1678a9249bed77a38b4686ce43e2ce4d7c867

commit_message:
WIP: node shell: add 2 sub-commands for console log

This patch adds 2 sub-commands to ironic command:

- ironic node-get-console-log <node_ident>
  Gets the content of a console log of a node.

- ironic node-clear-console-log <node_ident>
  Clears the content of a console log of a node.

NOTE: This is a proof-of-concept; unit tests will be added later.

Related-Bug: #1526368,#1553083
Change-Id: Ifcca7119416ea1b8b201c4fff72b8c6d7cf88299
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-ironicclient refs/changes/29/301729/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def do_node_get_console_log(cc, args): """Get the content for a node's console log.""" info = cc.node.get_console_log(args.node) print(info['content']) @cliutils.arg('node', metavar='<node>', help="Name or UUID of the node.") def do_node_clear_console_log(cc, args): """Clear the content for a node's console log.""" info = cc.node.clear_console_log(args.node) cliutils.print_dict(info, wrap=72) @cliutils.arg('node', metavar='<node>', help="Name or UUID of the node.")

commit_message:
WIP: node: adds console-log related methods

This patch adds 2 methods for console logging:

- get_console_log(self, node_uuid)
  Gets the content of a console log.
  (GET /v1/nodes/(node_ident)/states/console_log)

- clear_console_log(self, node_uuid)
  Clears the content of a console log.
  (DELETE /v1/nodes/(node_ident)/states/console_log)

NOTE: This is a proof-of-concept; unit tests will be added later.

Related-Bug: #1526368,#1553083
Change-Id: I5e7c3127bfaa8215dfd844786e81217f265e853a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-ironicclient refs/changes/28/301728/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def get_console_log(self, node_uuid): """Get the content of a console log :param node_uuid: The UUID of the node. """ path = "%s/states/console_log" % node_uuid info = self.get(path) if not info: return {} return info.to_dict() def clear_console_log(self, node_uuid): """Clear the content of a console log :param node_uuid: The UUID of the node. """ path = "%s/states/console_log" % node_uuid return self.delete(path)

commit_message:
WIP: ironic: Add serial console capability

This patch adds get_serial_console() to
nova.virt.ironic.driver.IronicDriver. It uses 'node.get_console'
to aquire information to connect to a serial console of a node.

NOTE: This is a proof-of-concept; unit tests will be added later.

Related-Bug: #1553083

added_lines: import six.moves.urllib.parse as urlparsefrom nova.console import type as ctype def get_serial_console(self, context, instance): """Aquire serial console information. :param context: request context :param instance: nova.objects.instance.Instance to acquire its serial console connection :returns: ConsoleSerial object """ node = self._validate_instance_and_node(instance) try: console = self.ironicclient.call("node.get_console", node.uuid) if not console["console_enabled"]: self.ironicclient.call("node.set_console_mode", node.uuid, True) console = self.ironicclient.call("node.get_console", node.uuid) except (exception.NovaException, # Retry failed ironic.exc.InternalServerError, # Validations ironic.exc.BadRequest) as e: # Maintenance msg = (_LE("Failed to request Ironic to aquire serial console " "of %(inst)s: %(reason)s") % {'inst': instance.uuid, 'reason': six.text_type(e)}) LOG.error(msg) raise exception.ConsoleNotAvailable() console_info = console["console_info"] if console_info["type"] != "ics": LOG.warning(_LW('The console type "%s" is not "ics".'), console_info["type"], instance=instance) raise exception.ConsoleNotAvailable() try: url = urlparse.urlparse(console_info.get("url"), "") except AttributeError: LOG.error(_LE('"%s" is not a valid URL.'), url, instance=instance) raise exception.ConsoleNotAvailable() if url.scheme != "tcp": LOG.warning(_LW('"%s" is not supported.'), url.scheme, instance=instance) raise exception.ConsoleNotAvailable() return ctype.ConsoleSerial(host=url.hostname, port=url.port)

commit_message:
WIP: ironic: add console-log capability

This patch adds get_console_output() to
nova.virt.ironic.driver.IronicDriver class. It uses
'node.get_console_log' to aquire console log.

NOTE: This is a proof-of-concept; unit tests will be added later.

Related-Bug: #1526368
Change-Id: Ic697f822c1c52a38ad9f225306da5df78ca95660
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/84/302084/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def get_console_output(self, context, instance): """Aquire the content of a console log. :param context: request context :param instance: nova.objects.instance.Instance to acquire its serial console connection :returns: console log text """ node = self._validate_instance_and_node(instance) try: console_log = self.ironicclient.call("node.get_console_log", node.uuid) except (exception.NovaException, # Retry failed ironic.exc.InternalServerError, # Validations ironic.exc.BadRequest) as e: # Maintenance raise exception.ConsoleLogOutputException( reason=six.text_type(e), instance_id=instance.uuid) return console_log['content']

commit_message:
WIP: REST API: add an API controller for console log

This patch adds NodeConsoleLogController class to
ironic.api.controllers.v1.node. It has 2 methods below:

- get(self, node_ident):
  Gets the content of a console log of a node.
  (GET /v1/nodes/(node_ident)/states/console_log)

- delete(self, node_ident):
  Clears the content of a console log of a node.
  (DELETE /v1/nodes/(node_ident)/states/console_log)

NOTE: This is a proof-of-concept; unit tests will be added later.

Related-Bug: #1526368
Change-Id: I1d9e06325001eb05ceb1511e6cbc207fb1b1ce26
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/18/301718/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class ConsoleLog(base.APIBase): """API representation of the console information for a node.""" content_type = wtypes.text """The content type: Currently, 'text/plain' is the only use case.""" content = wtypes.text """The console information. It typically includes the url to access the console and the type of the application that hosts the console.""" @classmethod def sample(cls): console = {'type': 'shellinabox', 'url': 'http://<hostname>:4201'} return cls(console_enabled=True, console_info=console) class NodeConsoleLogController(rest.RestController): @expose.expose(ConsoleLog, types.uuid_or_name) def get(self, node_ident): """Get the content of a console log file of a node. :param node_ident: UUID or logical name of a node. """ rpc_node = api_utils.get_rpc_node(node_ident) topic = pecan.request.rpcapi.get_topic_for(rpc_node) try: console_log = pecan.request.rpcapi.get_console_log( pecan.request.context, rpc_node.uuid, topic) except exception.NodeConsoleNotEnabled: raise return ConsoleLog(context_type=console_log['content-type'], content=console_log['content']) @expose.expose(None, types.uuid_or_name, status_code=http_client.ACCEPTED) def delete(self, node_ident): """Clear the content of a console log file of a node. :param node_ident: UUID or logical name of a node. """ rpc_node = api_utils.get_rpc_node(node_ident) topic = pecan.request.rpcapi.get_topic_for(rpc_node) pecan.request.rpcapi.clear_cosnole_node(pecan.request.context, rpc_node.uuid, topic) console_log = NodeConsoleLogController()

commit_message:
WIP: conductor manager: apply console-log related methods

This patch adds 2 RPC methods to connect ironic-conductor:

- get_console_log(self, context, node_id, topic=None):
  Gets the content of a console log of a node.

- clear_console_log(self, context, node_id, topic=None):
  Clears the content of a console log of a node.

NOTE: This is a proof-of-concept; unit tests will be added later.

Related-Bug: #1526368
Change-Id: Ib8e6e3f44192ca2eeec8fe54241e08cf1fff83f7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/17/301717/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: | 1.34 - Added get_console_log and clear_console_log RPC_API_VERSION = '1.34' def get_console_log(self, context, node_id, topic=None): """Get the content from a console log file of the node. :param context: request context. :param node_id: node id or uuid. :param topic: RPC topic. Defaults to self.topic. :raises: UnsupportedDriverExtension if the node's driver doesn't support console. :raises: InvalidParameterValue when the wrong driver info is specified. :raises: MissingParameterValue if a required parameter is missing :returns: a dictionary containing the content type like MIME and a part of the console log text. """ cctxt = self.client.prepare(topic=topic or self.topic, version='1.32') return cctxt.call(context, 'get_console_log', node_id=node_id) def clear_console_log(self, context, node_id, topic=None): """Clear the content of a console log file of the node. :param context: request context. :param node_id: node id or uuid. :param topic: RPC topic. Defaults to self.topic. :raises: UnsupportedDriverExtension if the node's driver doesn't support console. :raises: InvalidParameterValue when the wrong driver info is specified. :raises: MissingParameterValue if a required parameter is missing """ cctxt = self.client.prepare(topic=topic or self.topic, version='1.32') return cctxt.cast(context, 'clear_console_log', node_id=node_id)

commit_message:
WIP: SSH: add SSHIcsConsole class

SSHIcsConsole is a console driver with SSH and ironic console server.
It has remote console capability and console logging one.

For remote console:
- start_console(self, task):
- stop_console(self, task):
- get_console(self, task):

For console logging:
- start_console_log(self, task):
- stop_console_log(self, task):
- get_console_log(self, task):
- clear_console_log(self, task):

Also, this patch adds ssh.get_console_driver(). It returns
SSHIcsConsole() when CONF.console.terminal contains 'ironic-console-server',
otherwise it returns ShellinaboxConsole().

NOTE: This is a proof-of-concept; unit tests will be added later.

Related-Bug: #1526368
Related-Bug: #1553083

Change-Id: I8e2d4bd9c2a45e0af6ee20482899e105fe34dd5d

commit_message:
WIP: IPMItool: add IPMIIcsConsole class

IPMIIcsConsole is a console driver with IPMItool and ironic console server.
It has remote console capability and console logging one.

For remote console:
- start_console(self, task):
- stop_console(self, task):
- get_console(self, task):

For console logging:
- start_console_log(self, task):
- stop_console_log(self, task):
- get_console_log(self, task):
- clear_console_log(self, task):

Also, this patch adds ipmitoo.get_console_driver(). It returns
IPMIIcsConsole() when CONF.console.terminal contains 'ironic-console-server',
otherwise it returns IPMIShellinaboxConsole().

NOTE: This is a proof-of-concept; unit tests will be added later.

Related-Bug: #1526368
Related-Bug: #1553083
Change-Id: I0d2b51c1a410807bc9dde574645c380af30650dd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/15/301715/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.console = ipmitool.get_console_driver()

commit_message:
WIP: console utils: add methods for ironic console server

This patch adds methods for console logging and serial console.

For serial console:
- get_ics_console_url(port):
- start_ics_console(node_uuid):
- stop_ics_console(node_uuid):

For console logging:
- start_ics_console_log(node_uuid, port, console_cmd):
- stop_ics_console_log(node_uuid):
- get_ics_console_log(node_uuid):
- clear_ics_console_log(node_uuid):

And related methods:
- _get_console_log_dir():
- _ensure_console_log_dir_exists():
- _get_console_log_file(node_uuid):
- _send_signal(node_uuid, signum):

NOTE: This is a proof-of-concept; unit tests will be added later.

Related-Bug: #1526368
Related-Bug: #1553083
Change-Id: I85ac28e6b8e3461dc06f98b07c4a8f0c78232e16
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/14/301714/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # -*- encoding: utf-8 -*- # # ironic-console-server.py: remote console server with logging output # # (C) 2016 Akira Yoshiyama <akirayoshiyama@gmail.com> # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # # usage: ironic-console-server [-h] [-a] [-d] [-p PORT] [-f FILENAME] [-c ARGV] # # optional arguments: # -h, --help show this help message and exit # -a open logfile as append mode # -d disable socket service on startup # -p PORT port number (default: 7777) # -f FILENAME log file name (default: typescript) # -c ARGV command line (default: /bin/sh, use quotes for arguments) # # on SIGHUP: re-open the log file (for rotation) # on SIGUSR1: enable socket service (for node-set-console-mode = ON) # on SIGUSR2: disable socket service (for node-set-console-mode = OFF) import argparse import copy import eventlet from eventlet.green import socket from eventlet import hubs import os import pty import select import shlex import signal import sys DEFAULT_PORT = 7777 DEFAULT_FILENAME = 'typescript' DEFAULT_COMMAND = '/bin/sh' CLIENTS = set() CHILD_PID = None CHILD_FD = None LOGFILE_FD = None LOGFILE = None IO_SIZE = 1024 SOCKET_ENABLED = True hubs.use_hub("selects") eventlet.monkey_patch() def reopen_logfile(*args): """Close and re-open the log file for rotation""" global LOGFILE_FD # Close the current file descriptor if needed if LOGFILE_FD is not None: LOGFILE_FD.close() # Re-open the log file LOGFILE_FD = open(LOGFILE, "wb", 1) def enable_socket(*args): """Enable socket service again""" global SOCKET_ENABLED SOCKET_ENABLED = True def disable_socket(*args): """Close exist sockets and disable socket service""" global SOCKET_ENABLED SOCKET_ENABLED = False for fd in CLIENTS: fd.close() def run_command_wrapper(argv): global CHILD_PID global CHILD_FD signal.signal(signal.SIGHUP, reopen_logfile) signal.signal(signal.SIGUSR1, enable_socket) signal.signal(signal.SIGUSR2, disable_socket) while True: CHILD_PID, CHILD_FD = pty.fork() if CHILD_PID == 0: # Child process os.execlp(argv[0], *argv) # Parent process while True: try: _r, _w, _x = select.select([CHILD_FD], [], []) except select.error as e: errno, msg = e if errno != 4: raise if not CHILD_FD in _r: continue try: data = os.read(CHILD_FD, IO_SIZE) except OSError: # Re-execute the command break LOGFILE_FD.write(data) for fd in CLIENTS: try: fd.sendall(data) except socket.error as e: if e[0] != 32: raise os.close(CHILD_FD) def read_socket(sock): while True: try: data = sock.recv(IO_SIZE) except socket.error as e: errno, msg = e if errno == socket.EBADF: break if not data: break try: os.write(CHILD_FD, data) except socket.error as e: if e[0] != 32: raise except OSError: # The command looks exited. pass CLIENTS.remove(sock) def run_services(port=DEFAULT_PORT, filename=DEFAULT_FILENAME, append=False, disabled=False, argv=None): global CLIENTS global LOGFILE global LOGFILE_FD global SOCKET_ENABLED prog = sys.argv[0] argv = shlex.split(argv) if disabled: SOCKET_ENABLED = False if append: LOGFILE_FD = open(filename, "ab", 1) else: LOGFILE_FD = open(filename, "wb", 1) LOGFILE = filename eventlet.spawn_n(run_command_wrapper, argv) try: print("%s starting up on port %s" % (prog, port)) server = eventlet.listen(('0.0.0.0', port)) while True: sock, address = server.accept() if SOCKET_ENABLED: print("new client:", address) CLIENTS.add(sock) eventlet.spawn_n(read_socket, sock) else: print("new client not accepted:", address) sock.close() except (KeyboardInterrupt, SystemExit): print("%s exiting." % prog) LOGFILE_FD.close() def main(): parser = argparse.ArgumentParser() parser.add_argument('-a', dest='append', action='store_true', help='open logfile as append mode') parser.add_argument('-d', dest='disabled', action='store_true', help='disable socket service on startup') parser.add_argument('-p', dest='port', type=int, default=DEFAULT_PORT, help='port number (default: %d)' % DEFAULT_PORT) parser.add_argument('-f', dest='filename', default=DEFAULT_FILENAME, help='log file name (default: %s)' % DEFAULT_FILENAME) parser.add_argument('-c', dest='argv', default=DEFAULT_COMMAND, help='command line (default: %s, use quotes for ' 'arguments)' % DEFAULT_COMMAND) options = parser.parse_args() run_services(**options.__dict__) if __name__ == '__main__': sys.exit(main())

subject: WIP: add ironic-console-server
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-06 14:38:32.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/f01b8c363d1e8d38dcfea7ec02f26b7830cfafc5', 'message': 'WIP: add ironic-console-server

This patch adds ironic-console-server. ironic-conductor runs
it per node. It connects the serial console of a node, saves
the output into a log file and provides socket service if
enabled.

usage: ironic-console-server [-h] [-a] [-d] [-p PORT] [-f FILENAME] [-c ARGV]

optional arguments:
  -h, --help   show this help message and exit
  -a           open logfile as append mode
  -d           disable socket service on startup
  -p PORT      port number (default: 7777)
  -f FILENAME  log file name (default: typescript)

on SIGHUP: re-open the log file (for rotation)
on SIGUSR1: enable socket service (for node-set-console-mode = ON)
on SIGUSR2: disable socket service (for node-set-console-mode = OFF)

NOTE: This is a proof-of-concept; unit tests will be added later.

commit_message:
WIP: add ironic-console-server

This patch adds ironic-console-server. ironic-conductor runs
it per node. It connects the serial console of a node, saves
the output into a log file and provides socket service if
enabled.

usage: ironic-console-server [-h] [-a] [-d] [-p PORT] [-f FILENAME] [-c ARGV]

optional arguments:
  -h, --help   show this help message and exit
  -a           open logfile as append mode
  -d           disable socket service on startup
  -p PORT      port number (default: 7777)
  -f FILENAME  log file name (default: typescript)
  -c ARGV      command line (default: /bin/sh, use quotes for arguments)

on SIGHUP: re-open the log file (for rotation)
on SIGUSR1: enable socket service (for console-mode = On)
on SIGUSR2: disable socket service (for console-mode = Off)

NOTE: This is a proof-of-concept; unit tests will be added later.

Related-Bug: #1526368
Related-Bug: #1553083
Change-Id: I61e1d40a977af27fb77f6ac7dbe8bba9020b50da
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/91/302291/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # -*- encoding: utf-8 -*- # # ironic-console-server: remote console server with logging output # # (C) 2016 Akira Yoshiyama <akirayoshiyama@gmail.com> # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # # usage: ironic-console-server [-h] [-a] [-d] [-p PORT] [-f FILENAME] [-c ARGV] # # optional arguments: # -h, --help show this help message and exit # -a open logfile as append mode # -d disable socket service on startup # -p PORT port number (default: 7777) # -f FILENAME log file name (default: typescript) # -c ARGV command line (default: /bin/sh, use quotes for arguments) # # on SIGHUP: re-open the log file (for rotation) # on SIGUSR1: enable socket service (for node-set-console-mode = ON) # on SIGUSR2: disable socket service (for node-set-console-mode = OFF) import argparse import eventlet from eventlet.green import socket from eventlet import hubs import os import pty import select import shlex import signal import sys DEFAULT_PORT = 7777 DEFAULT_FILENAME = 'typescript' DEFAULT_COMMAND = '/bin/sh' CLIENTS = set() CHILD_PID = None CHILD_FD = None LOGFILE_FD = None LOGFILE = None IO_SIZE = 1024 SOCKET_ENABLED = True hubs.use_hub("selects") eventlet.monkey_patch() def reopen_logfile(*args): """Close and re-open the log file for rotation""" global LOGFILE_FD # Close the current file descriptor if needed if LOGFILE_FD is not None: LOGFILE_FD.close() # Re-open the log file LOGFILE_FD = open(LOGFILE, "wb", 1) def enable_socket(*args): """Enable socket service again""" global SOCKET_ENABLED SOCKET_ENABLED = True def disable_socket(*args): """Close exist sockets and disable socket service""" global SOCKET_ENABLED SOCKET_ENABLED = False for fd in CLIENTS: fd.close() def run_command_wrapper(argv): global CHILD_PID global CHILD_FD signal.signal(signal.SIGHUP, reopen_logfile) signal.signal(signal.SIGUSR1, enable_socket) signal.signal(signal.SIGUSR2, disable_socket) while True: CHILD_PID, CHILD_FD = pty.fork() if CHILD_PID == 0: # Child process os.execlp(argv[0], *argv) # Parent process while True: try: _r, _w, _x = select.select([CHILD_FD], [], []) except select.error as e: errno, msg = e if errno != 4: raise if CHILD_FD not in _r: continue try: data = os.read(CHILD_FD, IO_SIZE) except OSError: # Re-execute the command break LOGFILE_FD.write(data) for fd in CLIENTS: try: fd.sendall(data) except socket.error as e: if e[0] != 32: raise os.close(CHILD_FD) def read_socket(sock): while True: try: data = sock.recv(IO_SIZE) except socket.error as e: errno, msg = e if errno == socket.EBADF: break if not data: break try: os.write(CHILD_FD, data) except socket.error as e: if e[0] != 32: raise except OSError: # The command looks exited. pass CLIENTS.remove(sock) def run_services(port=DEFAULT_PORT, filename=DEFAULT_FILENAME, append=False, disabled=False, argv=None): global CLIENTS global LOGFILE global LOGFILE_FD global SOCKET_ENABLED prog = sys.argv[0] argv = shlex.split(argv) if disabled: SOCKET_ENABLED = False if append: LOGFILE_FD = open(filename, "ab", 1) else: LOGFILE_FD = open(filename, "wb", 1) LOGFILE = filename eventlet.spawn_n(run_command_wrapper, argv) try: print("%s starting up on port %s" % (prog, port)) server = eventlet.listen(('0.0.0.0', port)) while True: sock, address = server.accept() if SOCKET_ENABLED: print("new client:", address) CLIENTS.add(sock) eventlet.spawn_n(read_socket, sock) else: print("new client not accepted:", address) sock.close() except (KeyboardInterrupt, SystemExit): print("%s exiting." % prog) LOGFILE_FD.close() def main(): parser = argparse.ArgumentParser() parser.add_argument('-a', dest='append', action='store_true', help='open logfile as append mode') parser.add_argument('-d', dest='disabled', action='store_true', help='disable socket service on startup') parser.add_argument('-p', dest='port', type=int, default=DEFAULT_PORT, help='port number (default: %d)' % DEFAULT_PORT) parser.add_argument('-f', dest='filename', default=DEFAULT_FILENAME, help='log file name (default: %s)' % DEFAULT_FILENAME) parser.add_argument('-c', dest='argv', default=DEFAULT_COMMAND, help='command line (default: %s, use quotes for ' 'arguments)' % DEFAULT_COMMAND) options = parser.parse_args() run_services(**options.__dict__) if __name__ == '__main__': sys.exit(main())

commit_message:
WIP: driver base: add methods for ConsoleInterface

This patch adds 4 methods to ironic.drivers.base.ConsoleInterface class below:

- start_console_log(self, task)
  Starts console logging of a node.

- stop_console_log(self, task)
  Stops console logging of a node.

- get_console_log(self, task)
  Gets the content of a console log of a node.

- clear_console_log(self, task)
  Clears the content of a console log of a node.

NOTE: This is a proof-of-concept; unit tests will be added later.

Related-Bug: #1526368
Change-Id: I3e726756e5e4412ddc887392e81bd8d67de1e228
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/13/301713/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def start_console_log(self, task): """Start console logging. :param task: a TaskManager instance containing the node to act on. """ def stop_console_log(self, task): """Stop console logging. :param task: a TaskManager instance containing the node to act on. """ def get_console_log(self, task): """Get connection information about the console. This method should return the necessary information for the client to access the console. :param task: a TaskManager instance containing the node to act on. :returns: content of the console log. """ def clean_console_log(self, task): """Clear console log file. :param task: a TaskManager instance containing the node to act on. """

commit_message:
Add grenade upgrade hooks to stop agent

This adds grenade upgrade hooks so the agent can actually
be stopped during an upgrade.

This is necessary now that vpnaas runs in a devstack plugin
because its agent will now no longer be stopped by the neutron
plugin inside of grenade.

Change-Id: I5271f0ef4f857eb5650612829d352a821416487a
Partial-Bug: #1579235
(cherry picked from commit a65310b7bbc1e48382876c8ac4868e60a0d47ba7)

commit_message:
Set path for neutron conf dir in devstack if missing

The variable NEUTRON_CONF_DIR is no longer available to the
script for functional setup. This defaults it to the correct
location if it's not already set.

Closes-Bug: #1579946
Change-Id: I060aea1de70d7939a8ea68771702f74a00d88fe9
(cherry picked from commit 3086f0247c7a47f93b4ce08eb6d9b60aaaf12b33)

commit_message:
Add PrettyTable requirement + fix py3 failure

PrettyTable was missing from requirements and was likely being installed
by a transient dependency. PrettyTable is used in the client to render
tables in the CLI.

Add py34 compatibility for unicode builtin. python34 tests are now
running on stable/libert, this cherry-pick fixes the broken python34
tests.

Change-Id: Ie92bfad1929a3b8014efeec996592714f3bba160
Closes-Bug: #1527023

commit_message:
Revise Vagrant install readme notes estimated run time

Bug description:
vagrant install readme notes vagrant up should take around 10min;
mine took 38min

Change-Id: Idc5312f30678850aaa25ac55b46e47a344f77b15
Closes-bug: #1577545

commit_message:
Untranslated help text found in Launch Instance window

This patch fixes missing untranslated strings found in help when
creating a new instance.

A user noticed this strings under:

Project > Instances > Launch Instance > Source
  The source.help.html was using <li> tags wasn't contained in
  a parent element <ul>. For this reason gettext was failing
  to translate these strings.  Now using <dd> as suggested by
  reviewers

Project > Instances > Launch Instance > Security Groups
  There was a & (ampersand) in security-groups.help.html breaking
  the translation of a paragraph. Using the HTML Entity of &
  (&) solves the problem.

All .po files were updated to match new markup in the two  *.html
files

Change-Id: Ia5b4456d783ce10ae861103bb3bb1f58f9222d34
Closes-bug: #1561558

commit_message:
[WIP] objects: Verify the UUIDness

This commit enforces UUID type check for UUIDfield, which will occur
in next major version of oslo.versionedobjects. For future details, see
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.versionedobjects/api/fields.html#oslo_versionedobjects.fields.UUIDField

Change-Id: I0a87c39aef7ec36b5ff31e7442130ea0cab0204d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/20/316620/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import uuid# TODO(gcb) Uncomment below when oslo.versionedobjects validates UUIDs # UUIDField = fields.UUIDFieldclass UUID(FieldType): @staticmethod def coerce(obj, attr, value): uuid.UUID(str(value)) return str(value) class UUIDField(AutoTypedField): AUTO_TYPE = UUID()

commit_message:
Rename deprecated configuration options

https://review.openstack.org/301167 and https://review.openstack.org/185080
deprecated all Tempest configuration options including the "tenant"
term, and moved some options from the identity section to the auth
one.

Change-Id: Ibb29da9d543907063785256f8906199f111a38e4

commit_message:
Pecan: skip all notifications on failures

If there was a bad status code, none of the notification
logic should attempt to process. A bad status code means
that the assumptions the notification code makes about
original resources being present may not be true.

This also fixes the exception translator so the correct
status code is set by the hook on exceptions that have
a fault map entry.

Closes-Bug: #1557516
Change-Id: Ibff419e7caa6de422f04eb1e43fd2aed304bdd97

commit_message:
Add unit test for keystone::config

There is no spect test for keystone::config, so add it.

Change-Id: Iebc4c6fbccabf118cf5744a124df9c5a97df2618
Closes-Bug: 1581282
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-keystone refs/changes/31/316531/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: require 'spec_helper' describe 'keystone::config' do let(:config_hash) do { 'DEFAULT/foo' => { 'value' => 'fooValue' }, 'DEFAULT/bar' => { 'value' => 'barValue' }, 'DEFAULT/baz' => { 'ensure' => 'absent' } } end shared_examples_for 'keystone_config' do let :params do { :keystone_config => config_hash } end it 'configures arbitrary keystone-config configurations' do is_expected.to contain_keystone_config('DEFAULT/foo').with_value('fooValue') is_expected.to contain_keystone_config('DEFAULT/bar').with_value('barValue') is_expected.to contain_keystone_config('DEFAULT/baz').with_ensure('absent') end end shared_examples_for 'keystone_paste_ini' do let :params do { :keystone_paste_ini => config_hash } end it 'configures arbitrary keystone-paste-ini configurations' do is_expected.to contain_keystone_paste_ini('DEFAULT/foo').with_value('fooValue') is_expected.to contain_keystone_paste_ini('DEFAULT/bar').with_value('barValue') is_expected.to contain_keystone_paste_ini('DEFAULT/baz').with_ensure('absent') end end on_supported_os({ :supported_os => OSDefaults.get_supported_os }).each do |os,facts| context "on #{os}" do let (:facts) do facts.merge!(OSDefaults.get_facts()) end it_configures 'keystone_config' it_configures 'keystone_paste_ini' end end end

commit_message:
Cisco nexus config manifest - obsolete parameter (switch_replay_count).

Due to fix: https://bugs.launchpad.net/networking-cisco/+bug/1469839,
the ml2_cisco replay count parameter is obsolete and no longer used.
This needs to be reflected in the tripleo-heat-templates as well as
puppet-neutron manifests.

Change-Id: I4967443fc978a6a0aba58cd3606ec3beeb49cbf1
Closes-bug:  #1551387
(cherry picked from commit f0801dc4c01adaf64f8ed83b6fc100f18acabd13)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-neutron refs/changes/11/316911/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # (optional) This configuration item is OBSOLETE. The Nexus driver replay # behavior is to continue to attempt to connect to the down Nexus device # with a period equal to the heartbeat time interval. This was previously: # Number of times to attempt config replay with switch. # This variable depends on switch_heartbeat_time being enabled. # Defaults to $::os_service_default $switch_replay_count = $::os_service_default, if ! is_service_default($switch_replay_count) { warning('The switch_replay_count parameter is obsolete. The Nexus driver will always attempt replay on reconnect, if enabled.') }
deleted_lines: # (optional) Number of times to attempt config replay with switch. # This variable depends on switch_heartbeat_time being enabled. # Defaults to 3 $switch_replay_count = 3,

commit_message:
Correcting help messages of baymodel

This patch corrects help messages of DNS option for baymodel-create,
and <baymodel> option for baymodel-show.

Change-Id: I5c32c90246114645630b2570c4be0c3125ca11d8

commit_message:
Fix deployment problem with File name too long error.

When deploying ceph-osd with xenial release, there is an error
'File name too long'
There is doc that recommends setting osd max object name len = 256
http://ceph.com/releases/v10-2-0-jewel-released/
section UPGRADING FROM INFERNALIS OR HAMMER

Change-Id: I055601b842c19a4fe15f0aed364776450e8b653e
Closes-Bug: 1580320
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-ceph-osd refs/changes/54/315854/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: osd max object name len = 256

subject: Allow user list without specifying domain
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-13 15:14:12.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/common/controller.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/test_v3_identity.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/0afaa2f96facf47ec2e4cdd313efccb936a2ae36', 'message': "Allow user list without specifying domain

With a single domain environment, users can be listed without
specifying a domain. When moving to a multiple domain environment,
this remains true for domain-scoped tokens but not for project-scoped
tokens. Project-scoped tokens currently only work if the domain_id
query parameter is specified. This has been a source of pain to many
users, and is unnecessary. Just as the desired domain is assumed to be
that to which the token is scoped when the token is domain-scoped,
keystone can assume the desired domain is that of the project's domain
when the token is project-scoped.

Conflicts:
	keystone/tests/unit/test_v3_identity.py

Change-Id: I1d06935c06661109a523c5b4547ff01f23235a89
Closes-Bug: 1479578
(cherry picked from commit c73a81e61d059f4ab9e9cc29bad5528e1459444b)
"}]
commit_message:
Allow user list without specifying domain

With a single domain environment, users can be listed without
specifying a domain. When moving to a multiple domain environment,
this remains true for domain-scoped tokens but not for project-scoped
tokens. Project-scoped tokens currently only work if the domain_id
query parameter is specified. This has been a source of pain to many
users, and is unnecessary. Just as the desired domain is assumed to be
that to which the token is scoped when the token is domain-scoped,
keystone can assume the desired domain is that of the project's domain
when the token is project-scoped.

Conflicts:
	keystone/tests/unit/test_v3_identity.py

Change-Id: I1d06935c06661109a523c5b4547ff01f23235a89
Closes-Bug: 1479578
(cherry picked from commit c73a81e61d059f4ab9e9cc29bad5528e1459444b)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/47/305347/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Create a new domain with a new project and user domain = unit.new_domain_ref() project = unit.new_project_ref(domain_id=domain['id']) self.resource_api.create_project(project['id'], project) # Create both project and domain role grants for the user so we # can get both project and domain scoped tokens self.assignment_api.create_grant( role_id=self.role_id, user_id=user['id'], project_id=project['id']) dom_auth = self.build_authentication_request( project_auth = self.build_authentication_request( user_id=user['id'], password=user['password'], project_id=project['id']) r = self.get(resource_url, auth=dom_auth) self.assertValidUserListResponse(r, ref=user, resource_url=resource_url) # Now try using a project scoped token resource_url = '/users' r = self.get(resource_url, auth=project_auth)
deleted_lines: # Create a user with a role on the domain so we can get a # domain scoped token domain = self.new_domain_ref() ref = self.new_user_ref(domain_id=domain['id']) ref_nd = ref.copy() ref_nd.pop('domain_id') auth = self.build_authentication_request( r = self.get(resource_url, auth=auth) # Now try the same thing without a domain token or filter, # which should fail r = self.get('/users', expected_status=exception.Unauthorized.code)

added_lines: | | +---------------------------+-----------------------------+ | | | | :ref:`n-key-spec-pfreeze` || Jul 04-06 | R-13 | | :ref:`n-key-spec-freeze` || | +---------------------------+-----------------------------+ | | | | :ref:`n-key-fpf` || Jul 18-22 | R-11 | | :ref:`n-key-midcycle` || | | | :ref:`n-key-ff` | | | +---------------------------+-----------------------------+ Keystone -------- .. _n-key-spec-pfreeze: Keystone Spec Proposal Freeze ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ The deadline for proposing a Keystone specification that will land in the Newton development cycle. .. _n-key-spec-freeze: Keystone Spec Freeze ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ The deadline for merging a Keystone Spec and appriving a blueprint. .. _n-key-fpf: Keystone Feature Proposal Freeze ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ The deadline for proposing code for an approved feature. The code must: show functionality and be ready for review. Approved features that miss the deadline will be moved to the backlog or the first milestone of the next release. .. _n-key-midcycle: Keystone Midcycle ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ The Keystone team will have their midcycle event this week. .. _n-key-ff: Keystone Feature Freeze ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ All approved features must be merged by this week. Please note, the Keystone Feature Freeze date is aligned with :ref:`n-ff`.

subject: Enhance exception handling for "network delete" command
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-17 12:49:51.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient/commit/27f74f46e60047b113ee2ac3ce7fc4dee73287ce', 'message': '[WIP] Enhance exception handling for "network delete" command

This patch rework "network delete" command following the
rules in doc/source/command-errors.rst.

In "network delete" command, there are multiple REST API
calls, and we should make as many of them as possible.
And log error for each one, give a better error message.
Also return a non-zero exit code.

Change-Id: I39ae087dd7bd08d049d513abfa6c5cab2bd13b2b
Partial-Bug: #1556719

commit_message:
Enhance exception handling for "network delete" command

This patch rework "network delete" command following the
rules in doc/source/command-errors.rst.

In "network delete" command, there are multiple REST API
calls, and we should make as many of them as possible.
And log error for each one, give a better error message.
Also return a non-zero exit code.

Change-Id: I39ae087dd7bd08d049d513abfa6c5cab2bd13b2b
Partial-Bug: #1556719
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/97/293997/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Failback will enable the host that has been frozen
revisions:

If user freezes the host before failover, the volume serivce will be enabled after failback,
and user doesn't need to thaw the host before modify the host although the 'Frozen' field in
service list is still True, this doesn't make sense, backend that is frozen must be thawed.

Change-Id: Iac03faa9c6cf96531db22e667bd9c194dff48221

will be enabled by failback, and user doesn't need to thaw the host
before modify the host, if this is expected, the 'Frozen' field in
cinder service list should be changed to 'False', but it may be better
that host that is frozen must be thawed.

Change-Id: Iac03faa9c6cf96531db22e667bd9c194dff48221
Closes-Bug: #1577417
"}]
commit_message:
Failback will enable the host that has been frozen

If user freezes the host before failover, the cinder volume serivce
will be enabled by failback, and user doesn't need to thaw the host
before modify the host, if this is expected, the 'Frozen' field in
cinder service list should be changed to 'False', but it may be better
that host that is frozen must be thawed.

Change-Id: Iac03faa9c6cf96531db22e667bd9c194dff48221
Closes-Bug: #1577417
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/34/312334/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if service.frozen: service.disabled = True service.disabled_reason = "frozen" else: service.disabled = False service.disabled_reason = ""

commit_message:
Remove unused arguments to images.fetch and images.fetch_to_raw

Functions were passing in user_id and project_id to these functions,
but they were not being used. This change allows a subsequent patch to
drop an instance object as a function argument which has no purpose
other than to provide these unused values.

Change-Id: I844b97523b28b327e76e01ef7f16b57a415418ec
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/82/315582/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def fetch(context, image_href, path, max_size=0):def fetch_to_raw(context, image_href, path, max_size=0): fetch(context, image_href, path_tmp, max_size=max_size)
deleted_lines: def fetch(context, image_href, path, _user_id, _project_id, max_size=0):def fetch_to_raw(context, image_href, path, user_id, project_id, max_size=0): fetch(context, image_href, path_tmp, user_id, project_id, max_size=max_size)

commit_message:
[admin-guide] Document pinning/NUMA image metadata

Extend the NUMA/CPU pinning to document the use of image metadata.

Change-Id: I22216ff2d0fa8322b4cebb312b7f70e9ba2b0539
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/94/316094/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: For more information about the syntax for ``hw:cpu_policy`` and ``hw:cpu_thread_policy``, refer to the `Flavors`_ guide. Applications are frequently packaged as images. For applications that require real-time or near real-time behavior, configure image metadata to ensure created instances are always pinned regardless of flavor. To configure an image to use pinned vCPUs and avoid thread siblings, run: .. code-block:: console # openstack image set [IMAGE_ID] \ --property hw_cpu_policy=dedicated \ --property hw_cpu_thread_policy=isolate Image metadata takes precedence over flavor extra specs: configuring competing policies will result in an exception. By setting a ``shared`` policy through image metadata, administrators can prevent users configuring CPU policies in flavors and impacting resource utilization. To configure this policy, run: .. code-block:: console # openstack image set [IMAGE_ID] --property hw_cpu_policy=shared For more information about Image metadata, refer to the `Image metadata`_ guide... _`Image metadata`: http://docs.openstack.org/image-guide/image-metadata.html
deleted_lines: For more information about the syntax for ``hw:cpu_policy`` and ``hw:cpu_thread_policy``, refer to the `Flavors`_ guide.
